deck.name: ⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Shotgun & Magic
deck.description_md:
This deck aims for [Prepared for the Worst](/card/02184) + [Shotgun](/card/01029) + [Extra Ammunition](/card/01026) late game weapon combination. Remembered that feeling when you opened the core box wanting to make [Shotgun](/card/01029) work with [Roland Banks](/card/01001) but couldn't? It lacked consistency provided by [Prepared for the Worst](/card/02184) that came with Dunwich Investigator Expansion. [Shotgun](/card/01029) is a power weapon with ammo / hand slot issue requiring some support. This deck offers **2 paths of tutoring** the sub-weapon : - Using cards on her 5 splash slots, [Shrivelling](/card/01060) can get into the vacant Arcane slot, searched up with [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063), which also tanks good amount of horror. Zoey needs it. - Using [Bandolier](/card/02147) to additionally equip [Machete](/card/01020) or [Knife](/card/01086). 2x [Knife](/card/01086) are not removed at any point on upgrade, for theme. (look at her portrait) These 4x melee assets improve the hit rate of [Prepared for the Worst](/card/02184) so it hit something even if not a [Shotgun](/card/01029), it make sure taking time to play [Bandolier](/card/02147) is not wasteful. Economy to prepare the [Shotgun](/card/01029) or pump [Physical Training](/card/01017) for [Vicious Blow (2)](/card/02299) is partly provided by Zoey's ability, and we add 2x [Stand Together](/card/02148) to the mix. [Bandolier](/card/02147)'s 2 resources are hard to swallow otherwise. This deck is almost a pure fighter except when [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063) hits the 1x [Rite of Seeking](/card/02028) once in a blue moon that god says she should investigate this night for a change. Find some clue getting partners! **► About "2 Packs Deck Guide"**
　A series of decks made with the new distribution model in mind, requiring a Revised Core Set box + **just 1 more** Investigator Expansion box. ⌂ character on the deck's name means the additional box it uses is [**The Dunwich Legacy Investigator Expansion**](https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror-the-card-game/products/dunwich-legacy-investigator-expansion/).
　It maximizes the chance of newcomers being able to build and learn to play the game, enjoying the story on Standard difficulty ASAP. They can then get into deck-building later if they wished to do so. [**See other decks in the "2 Packs Deck Guide" series here.**](https://arkhamdb.com/decklists/find?author=5argon&name=Packs+Deck+Guide) # Upgrade guide [//]: # (==================== TABLE START ====================) | | | | | 　Cost | 　Total | |:-:|:--|:-:|:--|--:|--:| |　　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01588) |　→　| [Stand Together](/card/02148) •••|3 XP|3 XP| |　　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01588) |　→　| [Stand Together](/card/02148) •••|3 XP|6 XP| |　　| [.45 Automatic](/card/01516) |　→　| [Shotgun](/card/01529) ••••|4 XP|10 XP| |　　| [.45 Automatic](/card/01516) |　→　| [Shotgun](/card/01529) ••••|4 XP|14 XP| |　　| [Evidence!](/card/01522) |　→　| [Extra Ammunition](/card/01526) •|1 XP|15 XP| |　　| [Evidence!](/card/01522) |　→　| [Extra Ammunition](/card/01526) •|1 XP|16 XP| |　　|[Guts](/card/01589) |　→　|[Moment of Respite](/card/02273) •••|3 XP|19 XP| |　　| [Vicious Blow](/card/01525) |　→　| [Vicious Blow](/card/02299) ••|2 XP|21 XP| |　　| [Vicious Blow](/card/01525) |　→　| [Vicious Blow](/card/02299) ••|2 XP|23 XP| |　　|[Guts](/card/01589) |　→　|[Moment of Respite](/card/02273) •••|3 XP|26 XP| |　| | | | | | | | **Extra** | | | | 26 XP | |　　|[Overpower](/card/01591) |　→　| [Monster Slayer](/card/02300) •••••|5 XP|31 XP| |　　|[Overpower](/card/01591) |　→　| [Monster Slayer](/card/02300) •••••|5 XP|36 XP| [(View at arkham-starter.com)](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/upgrade?%3D%3D) [//]: # (===================== TABLE END =====================) It is unlikely to reach "Extra" on Dunwich campaign which it gives so little XP. I expecting 20-24 XP to be an average of your blind run, so that's why the [Moment of Respite](/card/02273) + [Vicious Blow (2)](/card/02299) part looks like that. [Moment of Respite](/card/02273) needs to be able to come in at least 1x when your cumulative failed [Smite the Wicked](/card/02007) reach an annoying point. The position of [Shotgun](/card/01029)'s inclusion so soon is also assuming you are playing Dunwich. Any more late, you missed too much chance to blast the mid-campaign baddies. The Extra section is just in case you take her to other campaigns with higher XP output. (Perhaps you buy only Campaign Expansion going forward.) Otherwise, feel free to not take out the [Monster Slayer (5)](/card/02300) from your collection to the Side Deck. This XP expensive card is not critical to the deck at all, but is on the theme with Zoey. (She goes out to slay monsters at night.) # 2 Packs Team Compositions **2 Packs Deck Guide : The Dunwich Legacy** series is now complete with the following decks : - Zoey Samaras: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Shotgun & Magic](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40696) - Zoey Samaras: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Snipe the Wicked](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39059) - Rex Murphy: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Misfortune Foresight](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40697) - Rex Murphy: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Simple Dark Horse Rex Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40318) - Jenny Barnes: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Basic Quad-Boost Jenny Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/42576) - Jenny Barnes: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : News of Isabelle](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39057) - Jim Culver: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Aureolus-Axe](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41463) - "Ashcan" Pete: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Persistent Pete](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39056) - Roland Banks: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Flare Spam Roland Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/42578) - Daisy Walker: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Higher Willpower](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40317) - "Skids" O'Toole: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Adaptable / Typewriter](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41464) - Agnes Baker: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Average Dunwich Agnes Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41826) - Wendy Adams: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : 1 Combat Against All Odds](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40435) To help assembling a party made entirely from just 2 packs, I have a tool that let you browse team compositions for 2 players, 3 players, and 4 players, that has manageable amount of card overlaps or even none at all. The result is sorted from low to high overlaps. [**Click here to see all team comps.**](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/assembler?i=CgkKBTQwNjk2EAEKCQoFMzkwNTkQAQoJCgU0MDY5NxABCgkKBTQwMzE4EAEKCQoFNDI1NzYQAQoJCgUzOTA1NxABCgkKBTQxNDYzEAEKCQoFMzkwNTYQAQoJCgU0MjU3OBABCgkKBTQwMzE3EAEKCQoFNDE0NjQQAQoJCgU0MTgyNhABCgkKBTQwNDM1EAE%3D) # Card tips [**Knife**](/card/01586) Other than big thematic hit for Zoey, the +2 is actually awesome with [Vicious Blow (2)](/card/02299). It requires over-success to hit the highest potential, so +2 is very welcomed. Add some more from [Physical Training](/card/01017) to make it count. Handy in a messy fight that you are trying to preserve [Shotgun](/card/01029)'s ammo to have a [Knife](/card/01086) hidden in your [Bandolier](/card/02147). [Machete](/card/01020) only adds +1 and is weak on multiple engagements. Though I love the [Knife](/card/01086), keeping also 2x [Machete](/card/01020) around is good to improve [Prepared for the Worst](/card/02184) hit rate. --- [**Moment of Respite**](/card/02273) ••• This card came in later scenarios expecting that you had failed [Smite the Wicked](/card/02007) for a bit. It also retains the same commit icons of [Guts](/card/01089). --- [**Taunt**](/card/02017) Can be useful even with 1 enemy to engage so you don't blow your friend's head off with the [Shotgun](/card/01029). --- [**Shrivelling**](/card/01560) The 1 horror rebound can be an issue if you failed [Smite the Wicked](/card/02007) too many times. ["If it bleeds..."](/card/02225) and 2x [Moment of Respite](/card/02273) that came in at the end can alleviate this. --- [**Physical Training**](/card/01517) You may have heard that this kind of card is "deprecated". I don't agree, and it is not because this is a low pack count deck that I am forced to use this card. I **want** to use this card. The perfect pump Talent for this deck's combination, you can pump for [Shotgun](/card/01029)'s over-damage, or pump for [Shrivelling](/card/01060) hit to substitute the lack of [Holy Rosary](/card/01059), or pump to make [Vicious Blow (2)](/card/02299) deals +2 damages. If you are playing Dunwich campaign, you will thank the + that it can do, too! --- [**Stand Together**](/card/02148) ••• The art may make you think of using this while you are fighting off hoard of enemies together, but you do get hit with AoO if engaged just by trying to "stand together". Perhaps play while you are free of engagement before using [Taunt](/card/02017) to start fighting. --- [**Rite of Seeking**](/card/02028) Though only 1x copy, this is by far my favorite card in this deck. Not often we have a Guardian that can use Mystic card, and has 4 to not be that bothered by the 0 boost. [Physical Training](/card/01017) can even pump for more. Picking 2 clues as a Guardian feels great! Try helping out on 2 shroud locations. You may try 1x [Shrivelling](/card/01060) instead to add 2x of this card, if you are confident in [Bandolier](/card/02147) + [Prepared for the Worst](/card/02184) to get a sidearm for [Shotgun](/card/01029).

To take advantage of the rifle, this deck is better at higher player count. She cannot disengage outside of her splash cards to shoot. This card can help fixing a lot of trouble at no action, and to make [Dynamite Blast](/card/01024) / [Springfield M1903](/card/02226) plays. # HP Management This deck let you play a game of looking at enemy's HP, as you have [Zoey's Cross](/card/02006), [Beat Cop](/card/01018), [Vicious Blow](/card/01025), [Machete](/card/01020), [Springfield M1903](/card/02226), ... that deals different damages from 1 to around 3-4. [Zoey's Cross](/card/02006) and [Beat Cop](/card/01018) can be triggered after Hunter enemy moves into you but before it attacks, so you can make some play with something that was left with 1 HP. [Dynamite Blast](/card/01024) and [Springfield M1903](/card/02226) deals 3 damages, and therefore good to bring 4 HP enemy to 1 HP. # Card tips [**Springfield M1903**](/card/02226) •••• Again, this is using [Springfield M1903](/card/02226) with taboo which can shoot up to 1 location away. - [Elusive](/card/01050) is an obvious card to make cool plays with this gun as you get to move to nearby location. - [Blinding Light](/card/01066) / [Stray Cat](/card/01076) allows her to evade without using , and then you can shoot it on the same location. - [Stray Cat](/card/01076) being is great as you can potentially dump all 3 ammo to the same enemy with all your actions fully. - Other than evading to exhaust and break engagement, you can also shoot an enemy that your teammate is engaging. Fight action will not provoke attack of opportunity even if you are currently busy with your own enemies. --- [**Emergency Aid**](/card/02105) This card is mainly for healing [Beat Cop](/card/01018). It can also heal you after you use [Smoking Pipe](/card/02116) a lot. --- [**Zoey's Cross**](/card/02006) When using [Zoey's Cross](/card/02006), remember that it exhausts and costs a resources. The resource cost offset with Zoey's ability. Therefore if you choose not to damage the enemy, you get +1 resource. You may decide to not use the cross if your weapon can finish it easily. --- [**Teamwork**](/card/02018) Guns, [Beat Cop](/card/01018), and [Bandolier](/card/02147) and the one hand weapon to go with it costs considerably to setup. But because Zoey cannot evade without special cards, it is quite important to have something other than [Springfield M1903](/card/02226). (["player order"](https://arkhamdb.com/rules#In_Player_Order)) This deck's [Alyssa Graham](/card/02232) + [Think on Your Feet](/card/02025) tech works its fullest if Rex know he is going to draw the enemy he just saw. So try to be the lead as much as possible. # Card tips [**Magnifying Glass**](/card/01540) • The pick up ability can be used when you are playing with 2x [Magnifying Glass](/card/01540) but suddenly [Old Book of Lore (3)](/card/01686) came and you want to temporarily switch to it until its 2 secrets are all used up.\ Sometimes you need boost on non-Investigate test. In that case you can pick it up and commit away for +1 if passing means a lot to you. --- [**Deciphered Reality**](/card/02303) ••••• Don't forget the regular 1 clue picking of this **Investigate** action, before you pick 1 each from each location including the current location. (So you get 2 minimum from the current location.) Also Rex's can even pick up 1 more. This card's cost makes it hard to play in addition to its effect, but luckily he can use that icon just fine to get his ability going every round. --- [**Old Book of Lore**](/card/01686) ••• Rex wants to use his once each round. So he is also indirectly incentivized to distribute his workload, waiting for the next round to investigate for 2 clues again. (Especially if there are exactly 2 clues left.) This sort of card make good use of his remaining actions. You can tutor yourself (pick up some useful Skill cards like [Inquiring Mind](/card/02227)), or tutor your friends for anything. If someone played Rogue with Exceptional card, getting that 1x copy out may decide the victory of scenario. You can use [Alyssa Graham](/card/02232) to peek at any investigator's top card to aid the decision to use for this. Rex is not [Daisy Walker](/card/01002), reading book isn't free! It is still infinitely usable like the 0 XP version, even when out of secrets. --- [**Inquiring Mind**](/card/02227) This card can get oversuccess for Rex's even on 4 shroud (put down [Magnifying Glass](/card/01030) and [Alyssa Graham](/card/02232) too). But the real power of this card is to commit for others. There is no "commit only to test you perform" on this card. Combined with game rule that let you commit only 1 card to someone else, this card can get unlikely stats to the passing zone miraculously. (For example, getting ["Skids" O'Toole](/card/01003)'s 2 to pass [Frozen in Fear](/card/01164) check.) --- [**"I've got a plan!"**](/card/02107) This card will not see much use since you are busy moving and getting clues, and accuracy is not boosted by [Magnifying Glass](/card/01030). ([Alyssa Graham](/card/02232) is able to boost it.) But I believe new players are eager to perform many tasks as opposed to only focus on the primary task. This card make you feel giddy holding it much more than the classic [Mind over Matter](/card/01036). I think they are worth keeping to the end, even if not very efficient. (We play games for fun!) --- [**Hyperawareness**](/card/01534) Because of Rex's over-success mechanics, pump is not bad. On average you would have 1x [Magnifying Glass](/card/01030) and 1x [Alyssa Graham](/card/02232) on you for 6 . This value looks good, but only allows -1 to activate bonus clue on 3 shroud. Throwing in 1 resource will improve the chance greatly on Standard, especially when the special symbols are equivalent to -2. [Deciphered Reality](/card/02303) is expensive to play, but if you have spare resources, it would love some pumps as it has very high reward. pump is **also** good for Rex's 3 to get a comfortable Evade against 2 enemy. --- [**Think on Your Feet**](/card/02025) If you are going to move to the next location but you are out of action for this round, you are risking your plan to be ruined by enemy spawn in Mythos Phase, normally you would be hindered down and you choose how to resolve it among your teammates. With this card, not only you prevents that, you also gain extra "tempo" because you move to where you are going to anyway. You are not just moving to survive. (Watch this to understand tempo : [HOW TO WIN ARKHAM HORROR: THE CARD GAME | Understanding Tempo ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JeFdlHUpDJ4)) --- [**"I'm outta here!"**](/card/02151) VP location are often optional and out of the main path, and have you worry if you should just safely pass the scenario using Resign option. With this card, you can really go out there to grab extra Victory Point and just fly home if it turns out you can't make it in time due to bad token draws. Of course only works in Resign scenario, but at least it also has which Rex can use to get to 5 . Game rule states that you must drop all your clues when performing Resign, the same as when you are defeated. (So it is bad if you are defeated on a VP location that had been cleaned up.) With this card, you must also drop all your clues, but you can do it on any location you like. There is a "bug" in Dunwich's The House Always Wins scenario related to this rule, and this card can fix the bug. Please try to figure it out on your own what I am talking about!

A deck intentionally filled with 0 or 1 costed cards, except [Dark Horse](/card/02234), [Hyperawareness](/card/01034), and [Pickpocketing](/card/01046). A Seeker deck without [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033). Use [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) as a way to spend your Upkeep resource to 0 to activate [Dark Horse](/card/02234). If you trickle around 1 and 0 resources, then you can either 5 Evade or 6 once a turn. (You also have 2x [Magnifying Glass](/card/01030) to help boosting further, the upgraded version has no play cost.) [Pickpocketing](/card/01046) and [Rabbit's Foot](/card/01075) are card draw counter of [Rex's Curse](/card/02009) that keeps coming back taking away your Upkeep draws. This deck has about 10 skill cards, drawing likely makes you better at future tests. [Seeking Answers](/card/02023) and [Mind over Matter](/card/01036) are also 1 cost card great with [Dark Horse](/card/02234). We also make use of [Seeking Answers (2)](/card/01685) upgrade in your Revised Core Set purchase. Rex's ability goes well with this card. [Dr. William T. Maleson](/card/02302) again costs just 1 and also can play with Rex's ability when you put down a clue. You can picks 2 up together the next time or try [Seeking Answers (2)](/card/01685) to pick it back together with clues all around. Dropping a clue also enables [Inquiring Mind](/card/02227). The premium card in this deck is [Cryptic Research](/card/01043). It can support your team's fighter to setup. Unlike high XP assets, 2x purchase (8 XP) of this fast and 0 cost Event will likely be played and see results as soon as you draws into them while not breaking your [Dark Horse](/card/02234) plan. You can pair this deck with other decks that wants to take a shot at 2x [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033) in the off-class slots. ([My Jenny deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39057) in the same series do that, by the way!) **► About "2 Packs Deck Guide"**
　A series of decks made with the new distribution model in mind, requiring a Revised Core Set box + **just 1 more** Investigator Expansion box. ⌂ character on the deck's name means the additional box it uses is [**The Dunwich Legacy Investigator Expansion**](https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror-the-card-game/products/dunwich-legacy-investigator-expansion/).
　It maximizes the chance of newcomers being able to build and learn to play the game, enjoying the story on Standard difficulty ASAP. They can then get into deck-building later if they wished to do so. We have 2x Unidentified [Strange Solution](/card/02021) in the deck, yet it upgrades to 4 XP one on only 1 copy. This plan is with Dunwich campaign in mind which gives low XP. If we want both 2x [Cryptic Research](/card/01043) and 2x [Deduction (2)](/card/02150) ASAP before the campaign ends, we would have to hog useless 2x Unidentified [Strange Solution](/card/02021) in the deck for too long (essentially a commit after you done the identification) and even worse if you arrive at scenario 7-8 at only ~20 ish XP. Better to have 2x Unidentified to help identifying easier, turn one to something useful earlier, then turn the other copy into 4 XP upgrade for the finale. Therefore this plan expects you to finish identifying by 14 XP, and continue hogging 1x Unidentified version until 22 XP point. (You cannot remove both even though you recorded in the campaign log already, Researched rule states that it must be included by **upgrading**.) If you finish identifying it way earlier than 14 XP (e.g. by 10 XP point) and want to be an alchemist earlier, you can swap the "[Guts](/card/01089) -> [Cryptic Research](/card/01043)" plan for the solution upgrade one, getting rid of 2x Unidentified version completely earlier. (And having 1 less [Cryptic Research](/card/01043) to play with.) But at least, 2x [Magnifying Glass (1)](/card/01040) and 2x [Seeking Answers (2)](/card/01685) are must-have due to synergy with [Dark Horse](/card/02234) and Rex's ability, before messing with the solution. I believe [Higher Education](/card/02187) is not a priority upgrade in this deck when we have [Hyperawareness](/card/01034), and is awesome with Rex. If you are playing **without** Taboo, then feel free to move [Higher Education](/card/02187) earlier. At 6 XP it actually encourage me to keep using [Hyperawareness](/card/01034). ## Which Strange Solution? I have included 2 variants of the solution in the Side Deck. Your decision can change until you reach the upgrade point mid-campaign at 14 XP. - [Strange Solution: Acidic Ichor](/card/02263) : 2022 Taboo decrease the damage to just +1, making it work like cheap costed accurate gun. Still good for this deck, and it gets a boost from [Dark Horse](/card/02234). - [Strange Solution: Restorative Concoction](/card/02262) is a good choice if you took more physical trauma than expected, or your party is full of low health investigators. Compared to Acidic Ichor, it also has 4 supplies instead of 3. You can take this upgrade before 2x [Deduction (2)](/card/02150) if situation is dire. # 2 Packs Team Compositions **2 Packs Deck Guide : The Dunwich Legacy** series is now complete with the following decks : - Zoey Samaras: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Shotgun & Magic](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40696) - Zoey Samaras: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Snipe the Wicked](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39059) - Rex Murphy: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Misfortune Foresight](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40697) - Rex Murphy: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Simple Dark Horse Rex Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40318) - Jenny Barnes: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Basic Quad-Boost Jenny Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/42576) - Jenny Barnes: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : News of Isabelle](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39057) - Jim Culver: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Aureolus-Axe](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41463) - "Ashcan" Pete: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Persistent Pete](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39056) - Roland Banks: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Flare Spam Roland Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/42578) - Daisy Walker: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Higher Willpower](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40317) - "Skids" O'Toole: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Adaptable / Typewriter](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41464) - Agnes Baker: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Average Dunwich Agnes Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41826) - Wendy Adams: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : 1 Combat Against All Odds](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40435) To help assembling a party made entirely from just 2 packs, I have a tool that let you browse team compositions for 2 players, 3 players, and 4 players, that has manageable amount of card overlaps or even none at all. The result is sorted from low to high overlaps. [**Click here to see all team comps.**](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/assembler?i=CgkKBTQwNjk2EAEKCQoFMzkwNTkQAQoJCgU0MDY5NxABCgkKBTQwMzE4EAEKCQoFNDI1NzYQAQoJCgUzOTA1NxABCgkKBTQxNDYzEAEKCQoFMzkwNTYQAQoJCgU0MjU3OBABCgkKBTQwMzE3EAEKCQoFNDE0NjQQAQoJCgU0MTgyNhABCgkKBTQwNDM1EAE%3D) # Mulligan You start with 5 resources and that is kinda anti-[Dark Horse](/card/02234) thing to have. This deck have easy to remember Asset that costs more, great to drain out your starting resources in preparation. Try getting these at start. - [**Dark Horse**](/card/02234) (Cost 3) : The main thing of this deck. - [**Pickpocketing**](/card/01546) (Cost 2) : Can draw more and finally get you [Dark Horse](/card/02234) / [Hyperawareness](/card/01034). - [**Hyperawareness**](/card/01534) (Cost 2) : Can drain resources. With 2x copies each, they are hard to completely miss on mulligan. If you use 5 resources to put both [Dark Horse](/card/02234) and [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) on the first turn (possibly also the 0 cost [Magnifying Glass (1)](/card/01540)), you are setup to counter tests in the upcoming Mythos, or evade the spawning enemy better. # Card tips [**Dark Horse**](/card/02234) Pairing this with [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) is the path to victory / survival. Because at the very least, you can perform one Evade at 5 minimum to fix enemy spawn, though that left you forever poor. When you don't have [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) yet, you may need the "no resource" option in anticipation to perform or at both 4. (Perhaps a scenario location test, or just try not getting a treachery hit.) In Upkeep Phase, game rule states that you **draw before gaining resource**. You can see the card first before deciding whether to take the resource or not. If you are at 0 resource and see 1 cost card ([Seeking Answers (2)](/card/01685), [Rabbit's Foot](/card/01075), [Strange Solution](/card/02021), [Mind over Matter](/card/01036), [Dr. William T. Maleson](/card/02302)) you may decide to take a resource to play it back to 0 resource. Use various draw cards [Rabbit's Foot](/card/01075), [Pickpocketing](/card/01046), [Cryptic Research](/card/01043), [Search for the Truth](/card/02008) to get to [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) if you got bad starting draws. If you got caught with a test while having 1+ resources, [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) can drain resources to 0 to get [Dark Horse](/card/02234) activation to 4 still, even if the icons aren't matching. (Matching icon is the rule of committing cards.) --- [**Shortcut**](/card/02022) You can use it on yourself to do tricks with [Seeking Answers (2)](/card/01685) to expand the clue discovering range, or finding easier location to succeed. You can see this card as extending the range of Resign location. Since Resign will not cause AoO, together with this card as Fast, you pretty much ensure your safety regardless of enemy spawning when trying to work on last few things before you bail out near the Resign location. --- [**Rabbit's Foot**](/card/01575) Makes you a bit happier when [Rex's Curse](/card/02009) cause you to fail. This card is not Fortune! Note that a fixed [Rex's Curse](/card/02009) keeps coming back and likes to void your Upkeep draw. Taking a bit of time to equip this is the counter for the lack of draws more than you think. (I know it is tempting to throw it for .) --- [**Dr. William T. Maleson**](/card/02302) It is easy to forget how tanky this guy is for just 1 resource. 2 healths are very valuable. Watch he dies to test instead of you, and then you can use that 1 resource you got to [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) + instead of +. Sometimes dropping clue on easy location maintains tempo really well if you are going to [Seeking Answers (2)](/card/01685) on it. Succeed by 2 or more, discover all 2 from connecting locations, and discover 1 you just dropped using Rex's . --- [**Mind over Matter**](/card/01536) You can use [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) to boost further. This card at least allow Rex to punch 2 HP enemy to freedom without having to keep evading it. When fighting with , remember that you don't get bonus from [Magnifying Glass (1)](/card/01540) The thing about 1 resource round with [Dark Horse](/card/02234) + [Mind over Matter](/card/01036) vs. [Dark Horse](/card/02234) + [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) is that [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) gets you 5 once, but [Mind over Matter](/card/01036) gets you 5 three times in a row. Sometimes you really need to evade repeatedly to move away from 2 enemies, or wait for the fighter on hoards of enemies. And so, we not dare removing any [Mind over Matter](/card/01036) for his health safety. --- [**Cryptic Research**](/card/01543) •••• The priority is to make someone that can kill enemies in the team get their tools of the trade. If they already have some, use on yourself to assemble [Dark Horse](/card/02234) + [Hyperawareness](/card/01034) + [Dr. William T. Maleson](/card/02302) safety combo. In emergency, try counting the discard pile and determine if the "miracle cards" are both out, 1x out, or not yet. (Depending on what kind of emergency, it might be [Mind over Matter](/card/01036), [Inquiring Mind](/card/02227), [Deduction (2)](/card/02150), ...) This card is Fast, and can essentially "summon" a certain card out with a little help from probability calculation. Play only during your turn means it is not usable when inside a Mythos Phase test. Better to play one to get some cards earlier if you feel like you are lacking commits for Mythos defense. --- [**Seeking Answers**](/card/01685) •• This is a crazy card. It normally replace the regular 1 clue of the Investigate action with the 2 flexible clues (there is an errata that add "instead of", see more inside the card page), but with Rex's ability it is like you add back the regular 1 clue at your location, now you can get up to 3 clues at once. (Still not counting potential [Deduction](/card/01039).) [Magnifying Glass](/card/01040) is of course usable in this.

(So basically you pay 5 resources to try 3 damage, not so absurd for Jenny.) This allow stacking the same Ally too, making sure whatever you get you can put down. - [Sure Gamble](/card/01056) usually is a bit hard to use due to its 2 cost. I think they are good fit for Jenny's resources that can make her pass all kind of tests. - [Lone Wolf](/card/02188) is still useful despite Jenny's ability. You will need a lot of resources to use [Streetwise](/card/02189), [Backstab](/card/01051), [Cat Burglar](/card/01055), and [Dynamite Blast](/card/01024). (Or her [Jenny's Twin .45s](/card/02010).) - [Sure Gamble](/card/01056) can support [Switchblade (2)](/card/01252) if you want to ensure the 2 damage to finish off an enemy. If you start at 2 over the difficulty only is the problem. If you are 1 over the difficulty, only 0 makes you hit for 1 damage. Good idea to add [Quick Thinking](/card/02229) in this test as the 2-over criteria is the same. - Sometimes the scenario need you to Resign at the goal, yet [Searching for Izzie](/card/02011) spawns wayyy back when you are so close to the goal. This is when ["I'm outta here!"](/card/02151) gets serious. I believe that 1 copy is going to be awesome when it mattered. Otherwise, commit for [Backstab](/card/01051). - This is not going to happen often, but if you are going to Resign with ["I'm outta here!"](/card/02151), you can use [Shortcut](/card/02022) to drag enemies away from your team before bailing out, skipping all AoO. This may buy some setup time for your friends while it Hunter back to the party. (It must not be Massive.) # Lucky Dice Tips [Lucky Dice](/card/02230) does not say "exhaust", as long as you have 2 more resources you can keep revealing the next one. (Without putting the previous one back to the bag.) Doing so would increase the risk of hitting , however. But it is still a good use of Jenny's resources. The deck retains all 8 basic skill cards, to go with all-boosting theme of this deck. In the latter half of the campaign, try using their success-draw effect to get to [Lucky Dice](/card/02230) which is Exceptional, so only 1 copy allowed in the deck. At the end of upgrade you will have 2x [Sure Gamble](/card/01056), which can sometimes combo with [Lucky Dice](/card/02230) (thematically matched, awesome!) to try passing hopeless test, a test that you intentionally go in at skill value **below** the difficulty and hope for the flipped negative to win. You can use [Lucky Dice](/card/02230) until you see high enough minus that you can flip into the required value. Each 2 resources equals [Lucky Dice](/card/02230), [Streetwise](/card/02189), or [Sure Gamble](/card/01056). Conveniently Jenny gets you 2 resources each round. Think carefully when using them in combination. [Sure Gamble](/card/01056) is powerful but the other 2 options are reusable.

deck.name: ⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : News of Isabelle
deck.description_md:
Follow trail of Isabelle with information from the [Newspaper](/card/02155) and her trusty 3-man sidekicks. This Jenny is clue-focused. She can stay far away from your team, juking enemies along the way, while regenerating steady resources and come back with clues, replaying [Flashlight](/card/01087) and Allies with her wealth along the way. **► About "2 Packs Deck Guide"**
　A series of decks made with the new distribution model in mind, requiring a Revised Core Set box + **just 1 more** Investigator Expansion box. ⌂ character on the deck's name means the additional box it uses is [**The Dunwich Legacy Investigator Expansion**](https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror-the-card-game/products/dunwich-legacy-investigator-expansion/).
　It maximizes the chance of newcomers being able to build and learn to play the game, enjoying the story on Standard difficulty ASAP. They can then get into deck-building later if they wished to do so. [**See other decks in the "2 Packs Deck Guide" series here.**](https://arkhamdb.com/decklists/find?author=5argon&name=Packs+Deck+Guide) # How to play - 2x [Charisma](/card/01694) allows [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) + [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033) + [Cat Burglar](/card/01055) which she can play/replay with her wealth. - 2 of the allies [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033) and [Cat Burglar](/card/01055) nudge her middling stat to usable with permanent and boost. [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) provide a spare action to use on [Cat Burglar](/card/01055), or for replaying [Flashlight](/card/01087) while on the move, so enemies don't catch up with you while you go drain a new location. - You may have a mountain of resources after stabilizing with 2-3 allies. Don't go overboard in spending [Hard Knocks](/card/01049), remember that allies can die and you need to replay them. - Maintain [Newspaper](/card/02155) and [Flashlight](/card/01087) on hand. [Jenny's Twin .45s](/card/02010) takes backstage in this deck, you can just commit it away for +3 [Backstab](/card/01051). - Get away from any spawning enemy with [Cat Burglar](/card/01055) and continue working wherever she ended up at instead of killing it. Recommended to left odd clues here and there so you can work immediately after moving around. You can do this to arrive at [Izzie](/card/02011) quicker by surfing the enemies. - Hands-free attack events [Backstab](/card/01051) and [Sneak Attack](/card/01052) so you don't have to hold any weapon. Work on clues diligently to ensure she has resources to play their expensive 2~3 cost. [Cat Burglar](/card/01055)'s boost is needed for both. - Use exceptional cards to accelerates your investigation and clutch out a scenario. - [Scavenging](/card/01073) can bring back drained [Flashlight](/card/01087). Knock out an empty [Flashlight](/card/01087) to discard pile with Fast-play [Switchblade](/card/02152), if you got no treachery that cause the discard. - Overall feels like a greener, female [Monterey Jack](/card/08007). # Upgrade guide Depending on if your party has a dedicated fighter or not, decide whether to get the exceptional cards ([Ace in the Hole](/card/02266) + [The Gold Pocket Watch](/card/02305)) first, or the [Switchblade (2)](/card/02152) + [Opportunist (2)](/card/02231) set first. This matters a lot for Dunwich campaign, which you may only reach about 20 XP on your first play without a pumping [Delve Too Deep](/card/02111). ([Newspaper](/card/02155) is unreliable, and we don't have pump like [Hyperawareness](/card/01034).) # 2 Packs Team Compositions **2 Packs Deck Guide : The Dunwich Legacy** series is now complete with the following decks : - Zoey Samaras: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Shotgun & Magic](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40696) - Zoey Samaras: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Snipe the Wicked](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39059) - Rex Murphy: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Misfortune Foresight](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40697) - Rex Murphy: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Simple Dark Horse Rex Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40318) - Jenny Barnes: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Basic Quad-Boost Jenny Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/42576) - Jenny Barnes: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : News of Isabelle](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39057) - Jim Culver: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Aureolus-Axe](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41463) - "Ashcan" Pete: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Persistent Pete](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39056) - Roland Banks: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Flare Spam Roland Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/42578) - Daisy Walker: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Higher Willpower](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40317) - "Skids" O'Toole: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Adaptable / Typewriter](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41464) - Agnes Baker: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Average Dunwich Agnes Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41826) - Wendy Adams: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : 1 Combat Against All Odds](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40435) To help assembling a party made entirely from just 2 packs, I have a tool that let you browse team compositions for 2 players, 3 players, and 4 players, that has manageable amount of card overlaps or even none at all. The result is sorted from low to high overlaps. [**Click here to see all team comps.**](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/assembler?i=CgkKBTQwNjk2EAEKCQoFMzkwNTkQAQoJCgU0MDY5NxABCgkKBTQwMzE4EAEKCQoFNDI1NzYQAQoJCgUzOTA1NxABCgkKBTQxNDYzEAEKCQoFMzkwNTYQAQoJCgU0MjU3OBABCgkKBTQwMzE3EAEKCQoFNDE0NjQQAQoJCgU0MTgyNhABCgkKBTQwNDM1EAE%3D) # Unique () warning Since this deck is based on having [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033) + [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) online at the same time, two of very popular ally in and respectively, it is likely that you cannot have more or investigator as they would also want to put down these allies, but can't due to unique () rule. (Also you will be taking all physical copies of them.) # The 5 splashes 2x [**Newspaper**](/card/02155) A card that define this deck together with [Flashlight](/card/01087) and [Leo De Luca](/card/01048). You can run around and grab clues flexibly at various shroud requirement, while able to fend off threats with one-off events or [Cat Burglar](/card/01055).
2x [**Dr. Milan Christopher**](/card/01533) The only possible permanent boost for Jenny in this card pool that is not taking the hand, and not [Alyssa Graham](/card/02232). Jenny needs a nudge from her 3/3/3/3 to be what you want to do. We dedicate her splashes for him. Generates resources for playing attack events and the other 2 allies [Cat Burglar](/card/01055) and [Leo De Luca](/card/01048). (Total to 10 resources !!)
[**Scavenging**](/card/01573) This card makes her a great [Flashlight](/card/01087) user since she can bring it back. You just need to knock it out to discard pile, which is the task of [Switchblade](/card/02152) while an another hand is holding [Newspaper](/card/02155). You may need to get your first clue with [Newspaper](/card/02155) on an easy location if you are going for [Scavenging](/card/01073) trigger 2 succeed-by. [Hard Knocks](/card/01049) cannot boost , there is no [Lockpicks](/card/01687), and this deck has no more XP allowances for tabooed [Streetwise](/card/02189). You cannot bring back [The Gold Pocket Watch](/card/02305) since it is removed from the game. # Card tips [**Jenny's Twin .45s**](/card/02010) Not recommended to equip or you may lose your investigation gadgets. Focus on using evasion and getting clues as much as you can until one of 2x [Backstab](/card/01051) / 2x [Sneak Attack](/card/01052) arrives if you want to dispose an enemy. Commit it for +3 . Equip only when it is clear that scenario is transition to fighting phase. You can play and choose X as 0 in order to discard an empty [Flashlight](/card/01087) in a hurry if you have no other way, when you want to [Scavenging](/card/01073) it back.
[**Emergency Cache**](/card/01588) Despite her innate ability, [Lone Wolf](/card/02188), and [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033), she still need some more money if allies to play came in close succession.
[**Lone Wolf**](/card/02188) Encourages being away from the team, which [Cat Burglar](/card/01055) will make sure she could do so and coming back alive, and still not missing any turn without getting 1 more resource from [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033). If you can fulfill [Lone Wolf](/card/02188) + [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033) repeatedly, you are ready to use [Backstab](/card/01051) / [Sneak Attack](/card/01052) whenever you get them, along with having spare resources to replay the 2nd copy of the allies.
[**Quick Thinking**](/card/02229) Try it together where you want to [Scavenging](/card/01073), perhaps [Flashlight](/card/01087) on 2 shroud location.
[**Cat Burglar**](/card/01555) • You can equip 2 at the same time due to him not having constraint, if you want. This makes you ready to do [Backstab](/card/01051) and [Sneak Attack](/card/01052) better.
[**Switchblade**](/card/01544) The laughing stock weapon has a task in this deck that is to play Fast (not costing action) to get [Flashlight](/card/01087) out of your hand for [Scavenging](/card/01073). The other hand needs to be occupied with [Newspaper](/card/02155), following the game's rule of discarding asset. Jenny can sometimes pump into [Hard Knocks](/card/01049) to land that elusive +1 damage if really really needed to.
[**Switchblade**](/card/02152) •• • It gets real when upgraded. Not only you can still bump [Flashlight](/card/01087) out Fast, you have "the serial killer" combo you can pull off in a big fight due to its unlimited use. Find as many copies as [Opportunist (2)](/card/02231) as you can and repeatedly stab with both committed, perhaps with some [Hard Knocks](/card/01049) boost each time if you have the resources, to ensure they keeps coming back until the fighting is done. [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) action let you repeat this more, [Ace in the Hole](/card/02266) can get you 3 more, and [The Gold Pocket Watch](/card/02305) can get you even more. If multiple enemies exist, go from easier to harder so [Opportunist (2)](/card/02231) is not lost mid-way inside this combo.
[**Opportunist**](/card/02231) •• Allows you to perform the [Switchblade](/card/02152) combo attacks.
[**Ace in the Hole**](/card/02266) ••• General purpose card, you can pop it to drain a lot of clues or stab repeatedly with [Switchblade](/card/02152) + [Opportunist](/card/02231).

deck.description_md:
Special thing about Jim is he is a Mystic with both 3 and 3 , which goes against the "use for everything" Mystic style. I present this economical deck (only Dunwich + Core) that use card to support his and play. - Fighting, [Forbidden Knowledge](/card/01058) + [Jewel of Aureolus](/card/02269) feeds resources into [Fire Axe](/card/02032). [Grotesque Statue](/card/01071) forces out which allows [Fire Axe](/card/02032) to be able to repeatedly land 2 damages hit especially vs. 3 enemy. You get both Jim's 0 modifier and [Jewel of Aureolus](/card/02269)'s . - On the investigation side, in addition to [Rite of Seeking](/card/02028) / [Rite of Seeking (2)](/card/01689) / [Rite of Seeking (4)](/card/02233), Jim can bypass high shroud with [Art Student](/card/02149) and [Drawn to the Flame](/card/01064), in addition to able to use [Arcane Studies](/card/01062) to investigate normally with [Flashlight](/card/01087). Fund the studies with [Jewel of Aureolus](/card/02269). **► About "2 Packs Deck Guide"**
　A series of decks made with the new distribution model in mind, requiring a Revised Core Set box + **just 1 more** Investigator Expansion box. ⌂ character on the deck's name means the additional box it uses is [**The Dunwich Legacy Investigator Expansion**](https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror-the-card-game/products/dunwich-legacy-investigator-expansion/).

[**See other decks in the "2 Packs Deck Guide" series here.**](https://arkhamdb.com/decklists/find?author=5argon&name=Packs+Deck+Guide) [//]: # (==================== TABLE START ====================) | | | | | 　Cost | 　Total | |:-:|:--|:-:|:--|--:|--:| |　　| [Holy Rosary](/card/01559) |　→　| [Jewel of Aureolus](/card/02269) •••|3 XP|3 XP| |　　| [Holy Rosary](/card/01559) |　→　| [Jewel of Aureolus](/card/02269) •••|3 XP|6 XP| |　　| |　→　| [Blood Pact](/card/02191) •••|3 XP|9 XP| |　　| [Rite of Seeking](/card/02028) |　→　| [Rite of Seeking](/card/01689) ••|2 XP|11 XP| |　　| [Rite of Seeking](/card/02028) |　→　| [Rite of Seeking](/card/01689) ••|2 XP|13 XP| |　　| [Delve Too Deep](/card/02111) |　→　| [Grotesque Statue](/card/01571) ••••|4 XP|17 XP| |　　| [Delve Too Deep](/card/02111) |　→　| [Grotesque Statue](/card/01571) ••••|4 XP|21 XP| |　　| [Rite of Seeking](/card/01689) ••|　→　| [Rite of Seeking](/card/02233) ••••|2 XP|23 XP| |　　| [Rite of Seeking](/card/01689) ••|　→　| [Rite of Seeking](/card/02233) ••••|2 XP|25 XP| [(View at arkham-starter.com)](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/upgrade?%3D) [//]: # (===================== TABLE END =====================) If you are playing Dunwich Campaign, it gives low XP so you may not even reach the final [Rite of Seeking (4)](/card/02233), so don't worry. Aim for 2x [Grotesque Statue](/card/01071) by the end of campaign is all good. They requires aggressive use of [Delve Too Deep](/card/02111) to reach. # 2 Packs Team Compositions **2 Packs Deck Guide : The Dunwich Legacy** series is now complete with the following decks : - Zoey Samaras: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Shotgun & Magic](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40696) - Zoey Samaras: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Snipe the Wicked](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39059) - Rex Murphy: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Misfortune Foresight](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40697) - Rex Murphy: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Simple Dark Horse Rex Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40318) - Jenny Barnes: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Basic Quad-Boost Jenny Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/42576) - Jenny Barnes: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : News of Isabelle](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39057) - Jim Culver: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Aureolus-Axe](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41463) - "Ashcan" Pete: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Persistent Pete](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39056) - Roland Banks: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Flare Spam Roland Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/42578) - Daisy Walker: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Higher Willpower](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40317) - "Skids" O'Toole: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Adaptable / Typewriter](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41464) - Agnes Baker: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Average Dunwich Agnes Deck](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/41826) - Wendy Adams: [⌂ 2 Packs Deck Guide : 1 Combat Against All Odds](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/40435) To help assembling a party made entirely from just 2 packs, I have a tool that let you browse team compositions for 2 players, 3 players, and 4 players, that has manageable amount of card overlaps or even none at all. The result is sorted from low to high overlaps. [**Click here to see all team comps.**](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/assembler?i=CgkKBTQwNjk2EAEKCQoFMzkwNTkQAQoJCgU0MDY5NxABCgkKBTQwMzE4EAEKCQoFNDI1NzYQAQoJCgUzOTA1NxABCgkKBTQxNDYzEAEKCQoFMzkwNTYQAQoJCgU0MjU3OBABCgkKBTQwMzE3EAEKCQoFNDE0NjQQAQoJCgU0MTgyNhABCgkKBTQwNDM1EAE%3D) # How to use the Fire Axe - Having only 2 Weapon cards is risky, so we devote one splash card for [Prepared for the Worst](/card/02184) to help getting it. - Try using [Forbidden Knowledge](/card/01058) to get the 1 -> 0 resources hit again in the same round, in a hurry. You can put the horror on [Art Student](/card/02149). - Hope for [Jewel of Aureolus](/card/02269) to grant you "critical hit". This has many different paths you can choose. - If you just spent to 0, taking 2 resources will make the +1 damage you hoped to get "disappear". You may take the draw instead to retain the +1 damage, or 2 resources if vs. enemy with 1 HP left. - Or take 2 resources if you see that the symbol would cause you to fail. - In the case of friendly fire, then you reduce the friendly hit damage if you take the 2 resources to cause the damage to disappear. - If you have actions remaining, you can immediately use the 2 resources you just got to hit again at high +4 accuracy. If you are pressed to land killing hit on high enemy like 5 with no resources currently, an unboosted 3 "swing for symbol" maybe the right play to get you more resources. - Drawing is a natural way to get the signature [Jim's Trumpet](/card/02012) to add to the other hand. - Witching hour [Blood Pact](/card/07158). See below. # Card tips [**Blood Pact**](/card/02191) ••• [Fire Axe](/card/02032)'s disadvantage is that in order to land the +1, you must boost it by spending from something resources to 0 resource. Without [Jewel of Aureolus](/card/02269) or [Forbidden Knowledge](/card/01058) tricks you probably can swing that way once. Now at the round before Agenda advances, you can repeatedly swing at 0 resource relying on +3 here. This can potentially lands 4~6 damages! It being a Permanent makes this a reassuring combo. --- [**Jewel of Aureolus**](/card/02269) ••• You also get the when other investigators at your location got the symbols. This has synergy with "at your location" cards : [Jim's Trumpet](/card/02012), and [Hypnotic Gaze](/card/02153) as well. Try grouping up and fight on the same location. --- [**Art Student**](/card/02149) Good good card! Show the Seeker who is the boss when you take a clue out of VP location casually while gaining soaks. Worth Jim's splash slot! The play with [Forbidden Knowledge](/card/01058) is to get back 1 resource when 1/1 enemy is about to attack (Using window "after Hunter enemy moves", or in your turn if you are attacking with [Fire Axe](/card/02032) multiple times.), so [Art Student](/card/02149) dies exactly with all the assigned damage/horror. --- [**Arcane Studies**](/card/01562) This card is kinda hot together with [Jewel of Aureolus](/card/02269). Just a gentle push to his and he can work on 2-3 shroud on Standard just like a Seeker! Stay together with Seeker to farm resources from their investigation when they draws a symbol + [Jewel of Aureolus](/card/02269) , and you can keep funding your studies! Also without spoiling, both boosts are **very handy** in Dunwich campaign! (More than 1 scenario.) You will be glad this deck has 2x of this Talent never removed! --- [**Perception**](/card/01590) I don't want to bet on [Arcane Studies](/card/01062) entirely, especially in the first few rounds with no enemies and you don't have enough resources to set everything up. It is a good card to get on mulligan, since drawing can lead to setting up with other Asset, and you can work on clues. --- [**Hypnotic Gaze**](/card/02153) "Bad" card, but I know deep down you wanna play with this card sometimes. Ignore all the reasons and min-maxing tendency in you. Very specific tech is that if you pull an , you can use Jim's ability to treat it as and perform the counter. [Grotesque Statue](/card/01071) is of course handy to land the bounce damage. (Remember that works to convert to too.) --- [**Drawn to the Flame**](/card/01564) Together with [Art Student](/card/02149), Jim has a lot of ways to bypass high shroud or a location that says you can't investigate. --- [**Flashlight**](/card/01587) It is easy to forgot Jim's ability how it virtually increase the number of 0s in the bag. 0 or +1 vs. the test difficulty is actually not so hopeless with Jim. Try go at 4 shroud with [Flashlight](/card/01087) and be surprised. You can also keep going at it with his bare 3 especially when you have [Jim's Trumpet](/card/02012), to try getting a draw.

The result is sorted from low to high overlaps. [**Click here to see all team comps.**](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/assembler?i=CgkKBTQwNjk2EAEKCQoFMzkwNTkQAQoJCgU0MDY5NxABCgkKBTQwMzE4EAEKCQoFNDI1NzYQAQoJCgUzOTA1NxABCgkKBTQxNDYzEAEKCQoFMzkwNTYQAQoJCgU0MjU3OBABCgkKBTQwMzE3EAEKCQoFNDE0NjQQAQoJCgU0MTgyNhABCgkKBTQwNDM1EAE%3D) # The 5 splashes 2x [**Vicious Blow**](/card/01525) Pitch in to [Duke](/card/02014) or other investigators. With [Try and Try Again](/card/02309) you can aggressively use it without overcommitting. It makes a 5 with 3 damages! Since he has Duke right from start, you have more chance of insta-killing annoying 3 HP enemy just by finding a [Vicious Blow](/card/01025). (And perhaps [Try and Try Again](/card/02309) to play with.)
2x [**Deduction**](/card/01539) Pitch in to [Duke](/card/02014) or other investigators. With [Try and Try Again](/card/02309) you can aggressively use it without overcommitting. The play with [Duke](/card/02014)'s ability is that you can move into a location with enemy and nab 2 clues with [Deduction](/card/01039), since the AoO check occurs at the location you were before. You may then use various evasion card if you can't finish it since [Duke](/card/02014) exhausted, especially if this play gets the location completely drained. Human Pete can also go for [Deduction](/card/01039) play with [Try and Try Again](/card/02309) as a safety net vs. 2 (+1 advantage) or even 3 shroud (0 advantage), as these locations often has high amount of clues. (Though it maybe better if you don't try again if it fails the first time, keep it for [Duke](/card/02014).) Vs. 4 shroud, you can additionally add [Rise to the Occasion](/card/02192). [Newspaper](/card/02155) of course helps with everything.
1x [**Liquid Courage**](/card/02024) Drink up when you have to put horrors on yourself due to [Aquinnah](/card/01082) plays. He has 4 to drink and +1 more if you reached the upgrade [Peter Sylvestre (2)](/card/02035). ## Proxying the hot skills [Deduction](/card/01039) and [Vicious Blow](/card/01025) are super hot cards from the core set, this deck let you see exactly why people win games with them. That means if you have or , you maybe fighting for physical copies. If they are in demand, I recommended you proxy them using the Lv.2 [Deduction](/card/01039) and Lv.2 [Vicious Blow](/card/01025) from the Dunwich box instead and pretend they are level 0 version. And then perhaps when your or wants to upgrade to Lv.2, just trade cards with them so you get the real Lv.0 version. # Other tips You will soon notice interesting "division of labor" when you put down [Newspaper](/card/02155) and [Duke](/card/02014). If you have no clue, Pete can do 4 but Duke can do 6 , but if you use [Duke](/card/02014) first then [Newspaper](/card/02155) will deactivate, leaving Pete at 2 . So when facing 2~3 shroud, you may use Pete's 4 first, then Duke's 4 without the [Newspaper](/card/02155) effect. Try adding [Deduction](/card/01039) into the mix, and you have got fun quizzes to think about for every scenario. His ability can ready [Duke](/card/02014) obviously, but also [Try and Try Again](/card/02309) in this deck, so he can try again, again. The other target is [Aquinnah](/card/02308), which allows you to perform some AoO suicide in Investigation Phase once, then ready using the next nearest window, and use her one more time in Enemy Phase. Or simply beg for AoO in Investigation Phase up to 2 times. An important thing you get from [Peter Sylvestre](/card/02033) is +1 to base 4 , which allows him to Evade and exhaust-kick Hunter enemy away with [Bait and Switch](/card/02034), or sprint away with [Survival Instinct](/card/01081) (or together). This is what [Duke](/card/02014) can't do. Team up and help reducing damage that may lands on your good boy : ) [Peter Sylvestre](/card/02033) + [Charisma](/card/01694) also soaks spill horrors when playing with [Aquinnah](/card/01082). Use [Liquid Courage](/card/02024) to heal horror if that is not enough. [Aquinnah (1)](/card/01582) is skipped in the upgrade, I tried her so I could use [A Chance Encounter](/card/02270) earlier, but she ended up being expensive horror shield mostly. [Leather Coat](/card/01072) is better. Go for Lv. 3 directly. # Card tips [**Survival Instinct**](/card/01581), [**Survival Instinct**](/card/02235) •• After [Duke](/card/02014) exhausted you will likely want to evade and have more turns of using [Duke](/card/02014). You can combine with [Duke](/card/02014)'s move in and investigate into a location with enemy, so you can drop the engagement and pass through the location.
[**Peter Sylvestre**](/card/02033) Takes horror from using [Aquinnah](/card/01082), adds for evasion.
[**Peter Sylvestre**](/card/02035) •• Adds for drinking [Liquid Courage](/card/02024) and avoid treacheries. HINT : Some enemies forces you to win with and not , you will be pleased to have starting 5 .
[**Bait and Switch**](/card/02034) When avoiding Hunter enemy, you will notice "the race" that if you don't move afterwards, it will engage back even though you avoid damage this turn. This card turns the action economy of Hunter fighting in your favor, so it lay exhausted elsewhere and readies at that location, not finding anyone. This means you have the next turn without a test blocking you, use 3 actions however you want. Inversely, you can kick it to your teammate nearby so he can spend full 3 actions dealing with it instead of having to move. It also exhausts, so safe to go full offensive without worry about Enemy Phase damage or Retaliate. The bad thing is that this card does not give any bonus and Pete's 3 is not enough. [Peter Sylvestre](/card/02033) ups the chance of evasion, and you can use [Survival Instinct](/card/01081) together to move yourself also.
[**Newspaper**](/card/02155) If the location is not difficult, you can open by investigating on your own (4 ) to get the first clue, before transferring the work to [Duke](/card/02014) (4 ) once the [Newspaper](/card/02155) goes offline. It is also compatible with [Duke](/card/02014) if the location is difficult and you have no clue, giving you 6 . But [Duke](/card/02014) exhausts. You can still use [Rise to the Occasion](/card/02192) in attempting 4 difficulty or more shroud since it looks at your base skill value not boosts from [Newspaper](/card/02155), giving you a reassuring 7 .
[**Rise to the Occasion**](/card/02192) With 2 and 2 , you can often try working off-[Duke](/card/02014) with 5 and 5 . (Find a difficulty 4 test, doesn't work with 3.) [Try and Try Again](/card/02309) let you repeat this once more. It is great since 5 is just 1 more than 4, but the Standard difficulty's sweet spot is 2 more. This card is also useful with [Deduction](/card/01039) and [Vicious Blow](/card/01025) to turn your human action to be even better than [Duke](/card/02014), which cannot use [Rise to the Occasion](/card/02192) due to a new base 4.
[**A Chance Encounter**](/card/02270) This card gets committed for more than an actual use.. but the use case is interesting I was tempted to keep 1x copy in the deck just in case. It can get [Aquinnah](/card/01082) before moving into enemies, or get [Peter Sylvestre](/card/02033) for some horror soak when you already have [Aquinnah](/card/01082) and don't want to use her sanity to take spill horrors. You have limited time when bringing back [Aquinnah](/card/02308), so maybe it is time to use Pete's ready ability to AoO suicide twice, or once and tank Enemy Phase. Note that "you still take horror dealt by the attack" can be put on [Aquinnah](/card/02308), so in total she take 1 horror for the cost of ability and enemy's horror value. Normally you wouldn't so you can use her many times, taking only 1 horror per play. Now there is no need to preserve her sanity since [A Chance Encounter](/card/02270) expires at the end of round.
[**Aquinnah**](/card/01582) •, [**Aquinnah**](/card/02308) ••• Note that there is no window between each enemy's attack though you can arrange the attack as you wish. So you cannot use ready inside barrage of attacks. The way is try using [Aquinnah](/card/01082) once in Investigation Phase by taking action that cause AoO so it attacks you. Then ready and prepare her for one more time in Enemy Phase. Or use her twice in Investigation Phase with multiple AoO inducing actions. (Investigate, Play, Activate, ...)
[**Stroke of Luck**](/card/02271) •• May allow you to flex and pass critical end game scenario tests as needed. You can use the icon commit with [Try and Try Again](/card/02309). An another nice thing is that the card it replaces, [Rabbit's Foot](/card/01075), has the same icon. Beware that [Machete](/card/01020) does not have that +1 damage when you are engaged with nothing, trying to attack what others got in delving deep. And it is good idea to have [Brother Xavier](/card/02106) before using this card as he can take punishments for anyone, as well as + for your own safety. # Advanced? We add 4 Spell cards that uses without touching 2x [Shrivelling](/card/01060) that was there : 2x [Bind Monster](/card/02031) + 2x [Song of the Dead](/card/02112). Resulting in 6 Spell cards that [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063) can hit. # Hard compatibility Normally I made this series of 2 packs deck to be compatible with Standard only, which requires 4-6 stats to have fun, and 2-3 to have some chance. Hard-compatible deck will need some fun toys removed and add more no-nonsense stat boosters. In this deck, due to stacked boosts from [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033) + [Magnifying Glass](/card/01030) + [Higher Education](/card/02187), this deck "accidentally" reach the point that pass tests on Hard difficulty on her main role even if I am not intended to. (Still, limited card pool with Hard will be HARD.) If playing on Standard, you rarely need the +2 from [Higher Education](/card/02187) and instead using only +2 one. On Hard, [Higher Education](/card/02187)'s +2 became your daily routine to work on 3-4 shroud, and even need +4 to perform her secondary enemy management role. Good luck! # Card tips [**Preposterous Sketches**](/card/02186) A draw booster to get back to 5 cards that you can continue using [Higher Education](/card/02187). --- [**Song of the Dead**](/card/02112) •• Show off your experience from the Miskatonic Chorus Club. Mainly this just improve concentration of fight options for [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063) search, though for expensive 2 XP cost each. But we don't have any alternatives to [Shrivelling](/card/01060) in this card pool. It giving +1 is very welcomed in an off-class like this. --- [**Arcane Initiate**](/card/01563) Full power comes when 4 more Spell cards are added in the upgrades, which also charges up your hand faster for [Higher Education](/card/02187)'s 5 cards requirement. You can play [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033) on top to clean up the doom, or use [Painkillers](/card/02117) to kill her. (lol) --- [**Old Book of Lore**](/card/01531) Try to get [Holy Rosary](/card/01059) which [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063)'s tutor effect does not cover. Also since she can use free Tome for this, you can keep up with [Higher Education](/card/02187)'s 5 cards requirement easily. --- [**Fearless**](/card/02268) •• Play with [Painkillers](/card/02117) for more health heals / to support fixing [The Necronomicon](/card/01009). Use [Higher Education](/card/02187) to get to +2 over-success. If you just want to heal horror ASAP, you can get test from [Bind Monster](/card/02031) . Notice that these replaces [Preposterous Sketches](/card/02186), not touching any prior Skill cards. The reason is that : - 2x [Preposterous Sketches](/card/02186) were for drawing to 5 cards for [Higher Education](/card/02187), but after 4x Spell cards are added, I think [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063) can also fill this role if the search hit those spells. - Doing so improve Skill cards concentration to 10 / 30, should be good for deck with high draw power thanks to free Tome to [Old Book of Lore](/card/01031). The more you draw, the more ready to use tools you have to pass tests. Spending XP for this instead of powerful [Deduction (2)](/card/02150) is also quite bold, but I think we should go all the way the route in this deck. You may disagree and use [Deduction (2)](/card/02150) instead. --- [**Magnifying Glass**](/card/01540) • You can take it up to hand to temporarily satisfy the 5 cards [Higher Education](/card/02187) requirement, then Fast put them back down once you paid the boost. This way they essentially reduce the cards requirement you must have on hand. take up to hand is sometimes useful when you are dual-wielding [Magnifying Glass](/card/01040) and you fear that [The Necronomicon](/card/01009) may suddenly comes to bump it away. --- [**Shrivelling**](/card/01560) With Daisy you must remember that this card has no boost. [Higher Education](/card/02187) turns this janky Lv. 0 spell into a reliable sidearm, like [.45 Automatic](/card/01016) in a hand of investigator. Before then (first 6 XP), you must also find [Holy Rosary](/card/01059) as a minimum requirement. Use [Old Book of Lore](/card/01031) to do so. --- [**Bind Monster**](/card/02031) •• There is "the play" with [Higher Education](/card/02187) and [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033). After you managed to Evade the first time (must vs. monster's ), you can walk away and continue working to get funds from [Dr. Milan Christopher](/card/01033). Then you can pay that fund to pump +2 to [Higher Education](/card/02187) on the (3) test. (This test is a static 3 difficulty, unrelated to monster's value.) You can picture Milan dissecting the monster while you bind it still, for flavor. Play cost of this card is very expensive. But it let you get away from low monster spawn which tends to be a brute that hits for 2 health.

[**Click here to see all team comps.**](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/assembler?i=CgkKBTQwNjk2EAEKCQoFMzkwNTkQAQoJCgU0MDY5NxABCgkKBTQwMzE4EAEKCQoFNDI1NzYQAQoJCgUzOTA1NxABCgkKBTQxNDYzEAEKCQoFMzkwNTYQAQoJCgU0MjU3OBABCgkKBTQwMzE3EAEKCQoFNDE0NjQQAQoJCgU0MTgyNhABCgkKBTQwNDM1EAE%3D) # Tips - It is risky to only have 2x [Shrivelling](/card/01060) for fighting, so I also give her 2x [Baseball Bat](/card/01074). Then joining from Dunwich Legacy Investigator Expansion, we have 2x [Rise to the Occasion](/card/02192), 2x [Oops!](/card/02113), and the first + Ally Wendy is able to use : [Hired Muscle](/card/02027). Talents are mix of core set [Pickpocketing](/card/01046) as usual to fuel her token redraw, plus the new [Lone Wolf](/card/02188) which provide economy for [Will to Survive](/card/01085), [Leo De Luca](/card/01048), and [Scrapper](/card/02193). I see the amulet almost every scenario now because the deck is used up more each time. Conditional draw like [Pickpocketing](/card/01046) is not enough in scenario you can't find evasion chance. - Quick catch up of cards in hand and resources by playing it, put down [Wendy's Amulet](/card/01014), and play it again from discard pile. I was able to get back from near 0 resources and hand (was unlucky with the [Lone Wolf](/card/02188)) to the state ready to token redraw + play more [Will to Survive](/card/01085) with this. Try evade and move far from enemy with [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) when you are trying to get your bearings with [Emergency Cache (2)](/card/02194). - The draw will trigger [Abandoned and Alone](/card/01015) faster than you can arrange the play for [Will to Survive](/card/01085), and you will be glad that discard pile wiped didn't have any [Will to Survive](/card/01085). - After [Scrapper](/card/02193) is added it make sure resources gained translates to survival / killing. # Will to Survive tips **Definitely find [Leo De Luca](/card/01048)!** [Baseball Bat](/card/01074) is overall the best weapon. When you are assembling the combo and got the bat first, careful not to break it before [Will to Survive](/card/01085) come. (Take less fighting tests, use token redraw to avoid , etc.) If you can't reach equal stat to win (like having [Baseball Bat](/card/01074) but enemy is 4 ) and you are already engaged so you can't draw anymore, try using one of [Will to Survive](/card/01085) action to evade + [Pickpocketing](/card/01046) to try getting a miracle single commit card, like [Knife](/card/01086) or [Fire Axe](/card/02032), to keep the chain going. Good time to play [Will to Survive](/card/01085) is when [Wendy's Amulet](/card/01014) is on hand but not played yet. Pad the discard pile with [Emergency Cache (2)](/card/02194) before putting the [Wendy's Amulet](/card/01014) down and you will have resources ready complete with a commit to reach higher stat from the draw. Static boost is king as otherwise you will rapidly lose commits/resource for each action to turn 0% success into 100% success. This is the task of [Hired Muscle](/card/02027) in addition to weapon boosts. Then [Scrapper](/card/02193) is the queen as it covers both kind of actions you are doing in the [Will to Survive](/card/01085) chain, to fill in that last tiny bit with a resource. Don't be that stinky fantasizing about epic battle with [Will to Survive](/card/01085) and hog it for too long. Sometimes simply picking 3 clues for sure from a 3 shroud location is worth it if it is a roadblock or Victory point location you must leave soon. In rare situation you will need to boost inside [Will to Survive](/card/01085). But since this deck is a fighter Wendy, there are just 4 cards with icons : 2x [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) (one should be in play) and 2x [Flashlight](/card/01087). A spare on hand is worth keeping to reach 4 to swipe some clues off 4 shroud to mix up with clearing enemies, over discarding for token redraw . (e.g. When have a choice to discard [Manual Dexterity](/card/01092) or extra [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) for token redraw , I would keep [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) for his rare icon.) She can go around and fix sticky scenario card or Forced tests. (Though it expires before you can do the one saying "at the end of your turn" like [Frozen in Fear](/card/01164) because this one is "until the end of your turn".) They are often not higher than 4 or 4 , so she just win these easily. Remember that you can on other member's threat area of the same location. The [Hired Muscle](/card/02027) 2 damages trick : It having 3/1 soak means you should use 2 damages before letting go. You want as many actions as possible with [Will to Survive](/card/01085). Even with [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) sometimes you hate to spend one to walk into the enemy before you can go super saiyan. So it is either waiting for Hunter to walk here and tank 1 hit, or you walk in as your final action and tank 1 hit, waiting for the next turn you have full actions. [Hired Muscle](/card/02027)'s 3 health let you do just that, soaking 2 damages, to prepare for 4 burst hits the next turn. (Be careful of horror as you have [Abandoned and Alone](/card/01015). The only soak is [Leo De Luca](/card/01048).) - [Flashlight](/card/01087) can drain supplies and vacuum hard location. - Since you can't fail you are very good Retaliate destroyer without even evading. - [Lucky!](/card/01080) can be used to win higher difficulty tests in a pinch, essentially [Unexpected Courage](/card/01093) with 1 cost, that [Wendy's Amulet](/card/01014) can dig up. - [Eucatastrophe](/card/01692) is even more [Unexpected Courage](/card/01093) with its to succeed at different kind of hard tasks. Commit then play from discard with [Wendy's Amulet](/card/01014). (Taboo remove this card from play so you cannot play twice with the amulet trick.) # The 6 Weapon Cards All these level 0 weapon cards are not removed ever. Let's get accustomed to them. These applies to all weapons : - +2 + [Rise to the Occasion](/card/02192) = 6 vs. 3-4 . Quite the sweet spot on Standard, and you have token redraw. - +2 + [Hired Muscle](/card/02027) = 4 . This is at the good spot to get success with [Will to Survive](/card/01085) + [Leo De Luca](/card/01048). - With 2+ enemies always look to [Oops!](/card/02113) as your first "hedge" before any other (token redraw , [Lucky!](/card/01080), [Eucatastrophe](/card/01692), ...). Remember that the redirected damage can land on Aloof and Massive enemy. And vs. 2 you can 100% [Oops!](/card/02113) on it. - Once you get [Scrapper](/card/02193), it can fill in the task of [Hired Muscle](/card/02027) without commitment to keep them around, or use together to reach new height of for [Will to Survive](/card/01085) attacks. 2x [**Baseball Bat**](/card/01574) This card might as well be Excalibur with [Will to Survive](/card/01085). You prevent the bat breaking on all hits, as well as reaching 3 . Get [Hired Muscle](/card/02027) and you get the only repeatable 4 in this deck to play with [Will to Survive](/card/01085). You can perform 8 damages turn with [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) on the boss if it happen to not have more than 4 . (True story from my Standard Carcosa run.) --- 2x [**Knife**](/card/01586) The discard option is good for sniping some specific combat value to proc [Lucky!](/card/01080) or [Oops!](/card/02113) while the other hand is using [Flashlight](/card/01087). It can fill some niche that [Baseball Bat](/card/01074) and [Fire Axe](/card/02032) can't. More interesting is the basic +1 for 1 damage option. Normally that will not make much difference but in [Will to Survive](/card/01085) environment, going from 1 to 2 is a massive difference, since enemies often starts at 2 . [Will to Survive](/card/01085) is either 0% hitting or 100% hitting. The first option let Wendy starts 100% hitting some enemies that are good at but weak at . Then with [Hired Muscle](/card/02027) joining to get you repeated 3 on the first , you can perform "combo attack" with [Will to Survive](/card/01085) by using the knife throw only on the final hit, for maximum of 1 + 1 + 1 + 2 damages with [Leo De Luca](/card/01048). --- 2x [**Fire Axe**](/card/02032) This is like a more difficult [Baseball Bat](/card/01074) as it deals 2 damages but it does not give a boost. With [Hired Muscle](/card/02027), you maybe able to reach 2 enemies on [Will to Survive](/card/01085) turn after you use accurate swing to 0 resource on a higher enemy first. Repeated 2 damages with +0 (like [.32 Colt](/card/03020) in Carcosa pack but unlimited and cheap to play) is quite special for Wendy to do tricks with [Eucatastrophe](/card/01692). [Eucatastrophe](/card/01692) asks for it to be reduced to 0 which is easier with her 1 and +0 boost. The unboosted 0 resource swing is handy vs. 2 with [Oops!](/card/02113) since you cannot fail more than 2. # Talents [**Lone Wolf**](/card/02188) Get rich so you can have [Leo De Luca](/card/01048), play [Will to Survive](/card/01085) many times, afford [Hired Muscle](/card/02027), and pump into [Scrapper](/card/02193). When playing multiplayer and you start the round together, simply play later and have the other player left first to still get a resource. --- [**Pickpocketing**](/card/01546) Put down so you have healthy amount of cards to perform token redraw . [Scrapper](/card/02193)'s + can help get you more evades, trading resources into card draw. # Early scenario tips It will be hard before we get [Hired Muscle](/card/02027) and [Will to Survive](/card/01085). Your attacks are numbered by these 6 cards : 2x [Oops!](/card/02113) (commit), 2x [Overpower](/card/01091), 2x [Rise to the Occasion](/card/02192). Consider them "ammo" for your unlimited use weapons. This concentration of skill icons gets better when [Will to Survive](/card/01085) () and [Eucatastrophe](/card/01692) () joins later. A commit and spending 1-2 resources down to 0 resource to land [Fire Axe](/card/02032), or use [Baseball Bat](/card/01074) can get up to 5-6 . From there, your token redraw should be able to land the hit on 3-4 enemy. Keep healthy hand with [Pickpocketing](/card/01046). # Oops... here in the discard pile again This card looks like a lot of fun, but even in this deck geared for it, it is HARD to use. The primary function of this card is improving commit icon density of . 2x [Oops!](/card/02113), 2x [Overpower](/card/01091), 2x [Rise to the Occasion](/card/02192), 2x [Eucatastrophe](/card/01692), 2x [Will to Survive](/card/01085) (only commit when going to play with amulet) = a lot of chances to 5+ for dry [Baseball Bat](/card/01074). Giving Wendy a choice to kill when 2 HP enemy arrives, instead of just evade. Commit is nice, though, it gets very annoying in the discard pile. It is very hard to "get through" [Oops!](/card/02113) to something valuable like [Lucky!](/card/01080) or [Will to Survive](/card/01085) behind it with [Wendy's Amulet](/card/01014) since you must find 2 enemies first, and it cost 2 resources too! So plan ahead when you have to commit for if it would obscure something you want to replay or not. # Willpower icon drought Another notable weakness is how this deck has 0 commit icon, no pump (unlike that [Scrapper](/card/02193) covers), and no [Unexpected Courage](/card/01093)! Her 4 will be serviceable together with token redraw and [Lucky!](/card/01080). But a couple of unfortunate failures will hit her hard on the horror especially you have to account for [Abandoned and Alone](/card/01015) too, and only [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) can take 1 horror safely. [Eucatastrophe](/card/01692) joins much later so you can use its commit. But if you are worried (e.g. playing Carcosa campaign), changing [Rise to the Occasion](/card/02192) / [Knife](/card/01086) / [Pickpocketing](/card/01046) to [Unexpected Courage](/card/01093) / [Dig Deep](/card/01077) may help with that. (Removing [Pickpocketing](/card/01046) will reduce how often she can redraw tokens.)
