deck.name: Φ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Stones and Arrows
deck.description_md:
Go primitive with stones ([Ancient Stone](/card/04230), [Pnakotic Manuscripts](/card/04307)) and arrows ([Ornate Bow](/card/04204)). A simple deck of dumping many Relic cards inside The Forgotten Age Investigator Expansion box into it, then gacha them out with [Dr. Elli Horowitz](/card/04021). At the end of upgrades you will have 4 high XP team play cards : 2x [Cryptic Research](/card/01043) (can support others, or your own [Ancient Stone](/card/04230) triggering) and 2x [Pnakotic Manuscripts](/card/04307). Try assemble your team such that she can improve consistency of other teammates. **► About "2 Packs Deck Guide"**
　A series of decks made with the new distribution model in mind, requiring a Revised Core Set box + **just 1 more** Investigator Expansion box. Φ character on the deck's name means the additional box it uses is [**The Forgotten Age Investigator Expansion**](https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror-the-card-game/products/forgotten-age-investigator-expansion/).
　It maximizes the chance of newcomers being able to build and learn to play the game, enjoying the story on Standard difficulty ASAP. They can then get into deck-building later if they wished to do so. [**See other decks in the "2 Packs Deck Guide" series here.**](https://arkhamdb.com/decklists/find?author=5argon&name=Packs+Deck+Guide) [//]: # (==================== TABLE START ====================) | | | | | 　Cost | 　Total | |:-:|:--|:-:|:--|--:|--:| | | **19 XP Deck** | | | | 0 XP | |　　|[Unexpected Courage](/card/01593) |　→　|[Ornate Bow](/card/04204) •••|3 XP|3 XP| |　　| [Working a Hunch](/card/01537) |　→　| [Ancient Stone](/card/04022) •|1 XP|4 XP| |　　|[Unexpected Courage](/card/01593) |　→　|[Ornate Bow](/card/04204) •••|3 XP|7 XP| |　　| [Working a Hunch](/card/01537) |　→　| [Ancient Stone](/card/04022) •|1 XP|8 XP| |　☆　| [Ancient Stone](/card/04022) •|　→　| [Ancient Stone](/card/04230) ••••|3 XP|11 XP| |　☆　| [Ancient Stone](/card/04022) •|　→　| [Ancient Stone](/card/04231) ••••|0 XP|11 XP| |　　| [Vantage Point](/card/04306) |　→　| [Cryptic Research](/card/01543) ••••|4 XP|15 XP| |　　| [Vantage Point](/card/04306) |　→　| [Cryptic Research](/card/01543) ••••|4 XP|19 XP| |　| | | | | | | | **29 XP Deck** | | | | 19 XP | |　　|[Thermos](/card/04274) |　→　| [Pnakotic Manuscripts](/card/04307) •••••|5 XP|24 XP| |　　|[Thermos](/card/04274) |　→　| [Pnakotic Manuscripts](/card/04307) •••••|5 XP|29 XP| |　| | | | | | | | **Extra** | | | | 29 XP | |　　|[Perception](/card/01590) |　→　| [Seeking Answers](/card/01685) ••|2 XP|31 XP| |　　|[Perception](/card/01590) |　→　| [Seeking Answers](/card/01685) ••|2 XP|33 XP| |　　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01588) |　→　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01693) ••|2 XP|35 XP| |　　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01588) |　→　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01693) ••|2 XP|37 XP| |　　| [Magnifying Glass](/card/01530) |　→　| [Magnifying Glass](/card/01540) •|1 XP|38 XP| |　　| [Magnifying Glass](/card/01530) |　→　| [Magnifying Glass](/card/01540) •|1 XP|39 XP| [(View at arkham-starter.com)](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/upgrade?i=Cg5CCjE5IFhQIERlY2tIAQoSEgUwMTU5MxoFMDQyMDQwAzgDChISBTAxNTM3GgUwNDAyMjABOAQKEhIFMDE1OTMaBTA0MjA0MAM4BwoSEgUwMTUzNxoFMDQwMjIwATgIChcKA%%3D) [//]: # (===================== TABLE END =====================) ☆ : Using [Shrewd Analysis](/card/04106), you use 3 XP for both copies but you must select the upgraded versions at random. If you got the damage version, good! If you got the horror healing version, it can help alleviating [Call of the Unknown](/card/04009) punishments. # How to play Use [Vantage Point](/card/04306) on where you are moving to that has no clue (often low shroud), so you can move some clues elsewhere (e.g. VP locations) here then use her to investigate it. If enemy has alternate defeat condition as an ability on its card (often testing // all which she has), use [True Understanding](/card/04153) to grab some clues. [Truth from Fiction](/card/04152) is just more commit before you get to 20 XP+ range where you get some Assets using secrets. Note that you have to buy [Ancient Stone (1)](/card/04022) going into 2nd scenario so you have more scenarios to identify it. It is best that you get 4 XP+ in the 1st scenario so you can also buy 1x [Ornate Bow](/card/04204). If you got just 3 XP, give up on the stone and buy just [Ornate Bow](/card/04204). (Can't be helped, but bow is very useful.) After reaching 2x [Ornate Bow](/card/04204), mulligan for [Dr. Elli Horowitz](/card/04021) and put away all [Ornate Bow](/card/04204) back to deck. Hope that playing [Dr. Elli Horowitz](/card/04021) gets the [Ornate Bow](/card/04204) on her. If you can do this, your hand can hold [Ancient Stone](/card/04022) / [Flashlight](/card/01087) / [Magnifying Glass](/card/01030) / [Pnakotic Manuscripts](/card/04307) instead and would become a fine flex Seeker. If you got 5 resources to spare with [Backpack](/card/04037) + [Dr. Elli Horowitz](/card/04021), you can play [Backpack](/card/04037) first and intentionally not pick the [Ornate Bow](/card/04204) to improve the concentration of the bow when you play Elli next. After upgrading both [Ancient Stone (1)](/card/04022) for 3 XP with [Shrewd Analysis](/card/04106). We then use 8 XP to add 2x [Cryptic Research](/card/01043) that can fast draw 3 cards to combo with the stones. The next "stones" to get are 2x [Pnakotic Manuscripts](/card/04307) for 10 XP (!). It is a better target for [Truth from Fiction](/card/04152) than the [Ancient Stone](/card/04022), as well as an another "hit" with [Dr. Elli Horowitz](/card/04021) even if you didn't get the [Ornate Bow](/card/04204) as normal play cost is a hefty 5. Dead [Dr. Elli Horowitz](/card/04021) can take it to discard pile so you can play a 2nd copy without hitting Unique constraint. Before using [Cryptic Research](/card/01043) on yourself, ask your fighter if they need to find something or need more cards on hand or not. The timing which [Thermos](/card/04274) slowly goes out of the deck is around mid to late scenario, which I guess someone might got to 2 trauma around this point. Ursula has 3 and 4 which often means using on [Pnakotic Manuscripts](/card/04307) should pass the Revelation test without a commit. # Other tricks - You can take investigate action of [Flashlight](/card/01087) or unidentified [Ancient Stone](/card/04022) when using her ability. - Not often useful but very cool : You can hold the [Ornate Bow](/card/04204) and [Dr. Elli Horowitz](/card/04021) holds an another [Ornate Bow](/card/04204) if you want to go full fighting. To go for this, you need 1x [Ornate Bow](/card/04204) on you first without seeing the 2nd one. Use [Backpack](/card/04037) to thin down deck (don't pick [Ornate Bow](/card/04204) if found among 6 cards), then play [Dr. Elli Horowitz](/card/04021) and hope. Then you can nock 2 arrows on different bow and burst 6 damages. - [Jake Williams](/card/04008) : Has draw effect that works with the [Ancient Stone](/card/04230). # Solo? It is not impossible with her evasion, early 2x [Ornate Bow](/card/04204) purchases, and some luck with [Dr. Elli Horowitz](/card/04021). I put on the Solo tag anyway because it is theoretically possible to pull off, but it will be hard having to reload the bow without someone else taking off the heat. I would modify the starting deck to include 2x [Mind over Matter](/card/01036) and never remove them. Something like [Swarm of Rats](/card/01159) is bad to evade as it has high and Hunter to come back to annoy you later, when you could just punch it, but you have 1 !

deck.name: Φ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Leo Throwing Flames
deck.description_md:
A deck which crams all the "flame" cards in Forgotten Age Investigator Expansion into the first 19 XP : 2x [Flamethrower](/card/04305), 2x [Kerosene](/card/04304). (...and 2x [Treasure Hunter](/card/04025). He is holding a torch. Does that count?) **► About "2 Packs Deck Guide"**
　A series of decks made with the new distribution model in mind, requiring a Revised Core Set box + **just 1 more** Investigator Expansion box. Φ character on the deck's name means the additional box it uses is [**The Forgotten Age Investigator Expansion**](https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror-the-card-game/products/forgotten-age-investigator-expansion/).
　It maximizes the chance of newcomers being able to build and learn to play the game, enjoying the story on Standard difficulty ASAP. They can then get into deck-building later if they wished to do so. [**See other decks in the "2 Packs Deck Guide" series here.**](https://arkhamdb.com/decklists/find?author=5argon&name=Packs+Deck+Guide) [//]: # (==================== TABLE START ====================) | | | | | 　Cost | 　Total | |:-:|:--|:-:|:--|--:|--:| | | **19 XP Deck** | | | | 0 XP | |　　| |　→　|[Charisma](/card/01694) •••|3 XP|3 XP| |　　| [Guard Dog](/card/01521) |　→　| [Treasure Hunter](/card/04025) •|1 XP|4 XP| |　　| [Guard Dog](/card/01521) |　→　| [Treasure Hunter](/card/04025) •|1 XP|5 XP| |　　| [Survival Knife](/card/04017) |　→　| [Flamethrower](/card/04305) ••••• •|6 XP|11 XP| |　　| [Trusted](/card/04019) |　→　| [Kerosene](/card/04304) •|1 XP|12 XP| |　　| [Trusted](/card/04019) |　→　| [Kerosene](/card/04304) •|1 XP|13 XP| |　　| [Survival Knife](/card/04017) |　→　| [Flamethrower](/card/04305) ••••• •|6 XP|19 XP| |　| | | | | | | | **29 XP Deck** | | | | 19 XP | |　　| [Beat Cop](/card/01518) |　→　| [Beat Cop](/card/01528) ••|2 XP|21 XP| |　　| [Beat Cop](/card/01518) |　→　| [Beat Cop](/card/01528) ••|2 XP|23 XP| |　　| [Leo De Luca](/card/01548) |　→　| [Leo De Luca](/card/01554) •|1 XP|24 XP| |　　| [Leo De Luca](/card/01548) |　→　| [Leo De Luca](/card/01554) •|1 XP|25 XP| |　　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01588) |　→　| ["I've had worse…"](/card/01684) ••••|4 XP|29 XP| [(View at arkham-starter.com)](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/upgrade?%2BKGkhABMg0KBENvc3QSBVRvdGFsOgYIARABGAFCAggBSAFQAVocKFZpZXcgYXQgYXJraGFtLXN0YXJ0ZXIuY29tKWABGhgKBAgBEAMSBBIAGgAaCggBEAEgASgBMAEiJmh0dHBzOi8vYXJraGFtZGIuY29tL2RlY2svZWRpdC8yODQyNjQw) [//]: # (===================== TABLE END =====================) 2x [Flamethrower](/card/04305) fits in 19 XP even with Taboo on! If you are not playing Taboo and is taking this deck to Standalone Scenario at 19 XP, I suggest using spare 2 XP for 2x [Leo De Luca (1)](/card/01554). [Venturer](/card/04018) works with [.45 Automatic](/card/01016) / [Flamethrower](/card/04305) / [Flashlight](/card/01087) in the finished deck. I want to rush to 1x [Flamethrower](/card/04305) ASAP so [Venturer](/card/04018) has something good to do, but I think 1x [Charisma](/card/01694) and 2x [Treasure Hunter](/card/04025) are more impactful. (Just commit [Venturer](/card/04018) while waiting for your first [Flamethrower](/card/04305).) # How to play This deck performs unexpectedly good for such a mindless "throw all available decent Ally into the deck" Lv. 0 deck. I slotted this Leo in right in the middle of on-going campaign on my test play and he is doing serious work for a 0 XP deck. Being balanced on tanking, fighting, investigating, and even actions from [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) to help moving, engaging, revealing location, etc. ## Ability and resources His ability saves you an action and even reduce play cost. Playing [Guard Dog](/card/01021) at 2 cost and can even reload the dog while fighting without AoO felt really good. As long as resources aren't dry **when your turn begins** then he's good to go. Therefore the actual key card of this deck is [Emergency Cache](/card/01088). You don't know whether you will get an Ally in your Upkeep draw or not, and if you do get one but you don't have enough resources even after discount, you missed your chance to play as has to be triggered immediately on turn's start. The key to keep the Ally rolling is to keep your resources **3 or higher** by preemptively playing [Emergency Cache](/card/01088). The only problem will be drawing [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) in Upkeep, which requires 5 resources to immediately use the play. It is a shame I don't have XP space to upgrade [Beat Cop](/card/01018) to Lv. 2 one in the first 19 XP, but with Leo the Lv. 0 version is working quite well already. He gets +2 sanity to take and an important to land the attack, at 4 - 1 = 3 play cost. ## Charisma and Shifting Slots Thanks to the Revised Core Set, we all have [Charisma](/card/01694) in the collection now. (Though you can pretend you have one after paying 3 XP.) This is a very important card that works with [Mitch Brown](/card/04006), which gives 2 more slots for only **non-unique**. () Without [Charisma](/card/01694), there is sometimes conflicting order with [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) which is unique. Since there is only 1x [Mitch Brown](/card/04006) in the deck, a typical flow will be that you get either [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) (unique) or [Beat Cop](/card/01018) / [Guard Dog](/card/01021) (non-unique) first. Then you get one more among those three, before you found [Mitch Brown](/card/04006), making [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) + [non-unique]. 2 Ally is possible because you have [Charisma](/card/01694). Then after you put down [Mitch Brown](/card/04006), you have [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) + [non-unique] + [Mitch Brown](/card/04006), with [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) using [Charisma](/card/01694) quota (can host unique ally) and [Mitch Brown](/card/04006) using your normal Ally slot, and that [non-unique] **shifted to** using [Mitch Brown](/card/04006)'s extra slot seamlessly. Without [Charisma](/card/01694), the moment you play [Mitch Brown](/card/04006), [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) would fly away to discard pile. Right here you have 1 more non-unique slot to play too. (But don't let [Mitch Brown](/card/04006) dies, of course.) (Read about [Shifting Slots](https://arkhamdb.com/rules#Shifting_Slots) here.) ## Investigate! Have to say his 3 is impressive, like [Roland Banks](/card/01001). With help of [Scene of the Crime](/card/04103), [Intrepid](/card/04192), 2x [Perception](/card/01090) never removed, 2x [Flashlight](/card/01087) never removed, and [Treasure Hunter](/card/04025), he is a Guardian that can have some clues. Sometimes these clues are asked to be spent or dropped to bypass a treachery, so indirectly he is quite bulky not only for endless supply of Ally, but also by having some clues on him. Investigation plays very well with his ability. You no longer have to use your actual actions to play Ally (you do need to setup the weapons and other things), and you don't want to since you would miss the discount. Action saved from not manually playing Ally is often used to Investigate, helping your actual clue finders. ## Decorated Skull... is good Initially I add [Decorated Skull](/card/04026) just because he could, but I was pleasantly surprised what 1 draw and 1 resource **at the same time** meant for Leo. Screw mathematical action economy calculation. Payout of this card is different for Leo due to his ability. As said before, you want some resources ready just in case you get an Ally in Upkeep Phase so you can put them down right away on his . The here gives you **both** potential Ally to play and the resource in addition to one you will get on Upkeep! For example, if you have no Ally at all on hand / field and on the verge of death (often due to horror), and also having 0-1 resource, spending action on [Decorated Skull](/card/04026)'s is not a bad way to survive. In addition to Upkeep resource you will get to 3 resources that allows you to found-and-play [Beat Cop](/card/01018) to add 2 more sanity, as well as the draw to gacha the Ally up to your hand. Analyze your discard pile if you want to bet on drawing Ally on critical moment. (And of course survive the incoming Mythos Phase, before you can get to the trigger. [Take the Initiative](/card/04150) is good at this as it still have full .) # Tips - Leo has high chance to trigger [Intrepid](/card/04192) on any test he got in Standard difficulty, since he has starting 4 already. If you have [Leo De Luca](/card/01048), you get a longer turn with the boost. (Often you would have to Move, wasting some of the boosted action.) - He can help beating 4 shroud sometimes with either [Scene of the Crime](/card/04103), or activating [Intrepid](/card/04192) then commit [Perception](/card/01090) to get to 6 . - [Treasure Hunter](/card/04025) is a good target to send to die in order to add charges to [Decorated Skull](/card/04026). - Upgraded [Beat Cop (2)](/card/01028) "defeat" on used up the health unlike the base version that straight up discarding, so they gains compatibility with [Decorated Skull](/card/04026). Upgrade comes after 19 XP. - Despite Leo's Ally discount, this deck is not good at economy. (Weapons and [Scene of the Crime](/card/04103) are also expensive to play.) 2x [Emergency Cache](/card/01088) are all kept all the way, only replaced by an another economy related card 1x ["I've had worse…" (4)](/card/01684) at the end. (If you have ["I've had worse…" (2)](/card/05315) version from The Circle Undone, I think adding 2x of that one is better inside 29 XP. But this deck is limited to 2 packs.) - You can't kill-steal enemies on other players with [Flamethrower](/card/04305). You must engage with the enemy yourself. (And the other enemies you want to distribute damages, you must also currently engaging them.) But with [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) you would have a spare action to pick an enemy from your Seeker, etc. before turning up the heat. - Using [Leo Anderson](/card/04001)'s to play Ally will not reduce icon on [Take the Initiative](/card/04150). You are not **taking** a Play action, you just play. This is unlike [Ursula Downs](/card/04002) in the same expansion, it says "take" and she is susceptible to AoO while doing so too. # Solo? This deck has quite high density of investigation helpers, together with his 3 . He has his Ally for horror taking, high 4 for horror treachery resistant, Ally health to just take treachery damage. I think this deck has real chance in solo play.

I think [Custom Modifications](/card/09023) is best left at around 5 XP. # How to utilize clue dropping - [Analysis](/card/09049), [Bizarre Diagnosis](/card/09046) and [Captivating Discovery](/card/09047). - If you are about to fight and defeat an enemy on a location without any clue, then clue dropping is free, since you can pick back with his . - [Research Notes](/card/09045) (removed for [Press Pass](/card/09055) later) - [Press Pass](/card/09055) : Get free use of [Bizarre Diagnosis](/card/09046) and [Captivating Discovery](/card/09047), or real extra action after committing [Analysis](/card/09049). - [Roland's .38 Special](/card/01006) : You are in more control to create a location that get +3. Sometimes a scenario boss fight location normally does not have any clue. - [Cover Up](/card/01007) : Drop a clue on low shroud location then try picking back to fix it easier. # How to play - Since Roland's role is not a main clue finder, he is not afraid to drop clue and lose progress. Think of clues as his "mana" to play special cards. - Get economy to play guns, [Custom Modifications](/card/09023), [Press Pass](/card/09055), and [Field Agent](/card/09033) with [Empirical Hypothesis](/card/09041) : **☑☑ Research Grant**. Kill enemies and try to get **☑ Independent Variable** going together with his ability. - You cannot rely on just [Empirical Hypothesis](/card/09041) to cover your expense, turns out you will get this setup only half of the campaign. ["I've had worse…" (4)](/card/01684) is added later to improve resource consistency as well as cancelling away those double horror attacks. - Use [Captivating Discovery](/card/09047) to get the pairing card that is otherwise depend on luck or not having many tutors. [Custom Modifications](/card/09023) is a card with many XP poured in, so worth finding it ASAP when you have the gun, or inversely find the gun when you found it already. [Extra Ammunition](/card/01026) and [One in the Chamber](/card/09029) are also cards to be paired with the guns. - If playing The Scarlet Keys campaign, Roland's and [Field Agent](/card/09033)'s can instantly expose one concealed mini-card. - Don't forget to count the icon on [Analysis](/card/09049). This card can also be committed with no clues on you, you get just that . - **Don't forget to use the token redraw ability on [Custom Modifications](/card/09023).** This deck just came back from The Scarlet Keys campaign with so many shots to my friends head that I forgot I could redo the draw...

Show them your shamanic knife plays. - Her 2 will get some love from [St. Hubert's Key](/card/03269), [Flashlight](/card/01087), and [Arcane Studies](/card/01062). So she is not entirely reliant to finding [Rite of Seeking (2)](/card/01689). - Finally, her 3 get used with [Suggestion](/card/03268), adding to her high . 2x [Manual Dexterity](/card/01092) are also all retained, adding survivability and virtually reducing deck size from its draw effect. Since the upgrades are really dry and being careful not to replace any of the cards mentioned (yes, even [Arcane Studies](/card/01062), [Flashlight](/card/01087), and [Knife](/card/01086)), it opens up for 2x [Seal of the Elder Sign](/card/03312) (10 XP worth) to enter the campaign early. Akachi can pair with many interesting teammates to call out their at will. (Analysis below.) **► About "2 Packs Deck Guide"**

It is better than not drawing the token since it comes with positive value or effect. The "side-effect" of is often missed. For example looking at your own , it adds 1 charge to an asset. [Seal of the Elder Sign](/card/03312)'s advantage is that you can plan to get the side-effect at the moment you want. Pop the when there is a valuable card in the discard pile. - [Minh Thi Phan](/card/03002) : Return a skill card to the hand only if she commits it in the exact test that she got . (Do not choose [Seal of the Elder Sign](/card/03312) to return to hand since it is removed from game after test.) - [Sefina Rousseau](/card/03003) : +3 is high, and you can draw a utility Event like [Ward of Protection](/card/01065) up to hand to get ready for things. - [Daisy Walker](/card/01002) : Can get her a lot of draws. You can wait until she put down some books first. - ["Skids" O'Toole](/card/01003) : 2 resources may equal to an action for him. - [Wendy Adams](/card/01005) : Auto success with [Wendy's Amulet](/card/01014). She can use this to test some scenario quest which is often at high number but requiring a single success. Auto success also reduces the difficulty to 0, so it may open up combo with "zero difficulty" cards in The Scarlet Keys if you have it.

deck.name: ☻ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Two Packs Lola?? (Fight)
deck.description_md:
I love this hobby of creating low expansion count decks but damn, Lola really put me to test to finally get a deck that is able to do decently on Standard campaign. Despite hardship needing to be in the correct role to do stuff, Lola has access to Lv. 3 of multiple factions unlike most characters, so let's take advantage of that. We have a whopping 8 generic skill cards which stays til the end. This is as beginner-friendly I can get with Lola deck. (She is supposed to be for advanced players.) You can't even commit if you are in wrong color, unless it is neutral. So at least you have 8 cards that won't get stuck on hand if you misplayed your role swaps. 6 of them also have [True Survivor](/card/03273) support, so not completely mindless inclusion! **► About "2 Packs Deck Guide"**
　A series of decks made with the new distribution model in mind, requiring a Revised Core Set box + **just 1 more** Investigator Expansion box. ☻ character on the deck's name means the additional box it uses is [**The Path to Carcosa Investigator Expansion**](https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror-the-card-game/products/path-carcosa-investigator-expansion/).
　It maximizes the chance of newcomers being able to build and learn to play the game, enjoying the story on Standard difficulty ASAP. They can then get into deck-building later if they wished to do so. [**See other decks in the "2 Packs Deck Guide" series here.**](https://arkhamdb.com/decklists/find?author=5argon&name=Packs+Deck+Guide) [//]: # (==================== TABLE START ====================) | | | | | 　Cost | 　Total | |:-:|:--|:-:|:--|--:|--:| | | **19 XP Deck** | | | | 0 XP | |　　| [.45 Automatic](/card/01516) |　→　| [.45 Automatic](/card/03190) ••|2 XP|2 XP| |　　| [.45 Automatic](/card/01516) |　→　| [.45 Automatic](/card/03190) ••|2 XP|4 XP| |　　| [Stealth](/card/03028) |　→　| [Lupara](/card/03309) •••|3 XP|7 XP| |　　|[Flashlight](/card/01587) |　→　| [Lupara](/card/03309) •••|3 XP|10 XP| |　　| [Stray Cat](/card/01576) |　→　| [Will to Survive](/card/01585) •••|3 XP|13 XP| |　　| [Stray Cat](/card/01576) |　→　| [Will to Survive](/card/01585) •••|3 XP|16 XP| |　　|[Flashlight](/card/01587) |　→　| [True Survivor](/card/03273) •••|3 XP|19 XP| |　| | | | | | | | **29 XP Deck** | | | | 19 XP | |　　| [.32 Colt](/card/03020) |　→　| [Police Badge](/card/01527) ••|2 XP|21 XP| |　　| [.32 Colt](/card/03020) |　→　| [Police Badge](/card/01527) ••|2 XP|23 XP| |　　| [Beat Cop](/card/01518) |　→　| [Beat Cop](/card/01528) ••|2 XP|25 XP| |　　| [Beat Cop](/card/01518) |　→　| [Beat Cop](/card/01528) ••|2 XP|27 XP| |　　| [Leo De Luca](/card/01548) |　→　| [Leo De Luca](/card/01554) •|1 XP|28 XP| |　　| [Leo De Luca](/card/01548) |　→　| [Leo De Luca](/card/01554) •|1 XP|29 XP| |　| | | | | | | | **Extra** | | | | 29 XP | |　　| |　→　|[Charisma](/card/02158) •••|3 XP|32 XP| |　　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01588) |　→　|[Emergency Cache](/card/02194) ••|2 XP|34 XP| |　　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01588) |　→　|[Emergency Cache](/card/02194) ••|2 XP|36 XP| [(View at arkham-starter.com)](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/upgrade?%2BKGkhABMg0KBENvc3QSBVRvdGFsOgYIARABGAFCAggBSAFQAVocKFZpZXcgYXQgYXJraGFtLXN0YXJ0ZXIuY29tKWABGhgKBAgBEAMSBBIAGgAaCggBEAEgASgBMAEiJmh0dHBzOi8vYXJraGFtZGIuY29tL2RlY2svdmlldy8yNjc3NTQ3) [//]: # (===================== TABLE END =====================) **Difficulty Notice : ** Lola's deckbuilding requirement is obviously meant to be stronger the more player cards you have. She is 6th investigator in Carcosa, a "gift" kind of thing to also incentivized you to stick with the game longer. So her concept is completely against this economical 2 Packs Deck Guide series. Still, I want to provide more value for as many players starting out as possible with this deck series, that I tried making this Lola deck. So if you find she is underpowered playing this deck, seems like it is supposed to be that way. Good luck with the challenge! (And maybe you can discover other version of 2 packs Lola that I hadn't thought of?) You may notice that this is similar to lower ["Skids" O'Toole](/card/01003) with a splash of [Wendy Adams](/card/01005) ([Will to Survive](/card/01085) access, and 0 cost soaks [Cherished Keepsake](/card/03114) + [Leather Coat](/card/01072)) # Please use the Taboo Notice that [Lola Hayes](/card/03006) herself (front side) and [Crisis of Identity](/card/03019) got a positive Taboo. It is much better than what was printed on your physical copy. Limited card pool Lola would be a challenge even with these positive Taboo. # Early upgrade notes The first 10 XP focuses on getting +2 weapon into the deck and making [Sleight of Hand](/card/03029) not a dead draw. Even so 5 is kind of unreliable. You still better find [Beat Cop](/card/01018) ASAP or hoard [Overpower](/card/01091) / [Unexpected Courage](/card/01093) for that important strike vs. 4 enemy. [Sleight of Hand](/card/03029) is natural with [Lupara](/card/03309) but into [.45 Automatic (2)](/card/03190) is a bit trickier. You probably need to be from earlier turn, so you can use [Sleight of Hand](/card/03029) and then change to to shoot the guns the next turn you want to fight. Taboo Lola can swap role 2 times with but you don't want to waste actions in [Sleight of Hand](/card/03029) turn. [Stealth](/card/03028) : This card is getting removed but until then, use it to evade non-Hunter enemy. You need to move away once to left it there. If it is Hunter, then you need to move away **twice** because it didn't exhaust and it is going to come whack you, that's your whole turn! The only merit of this card is that it helps with Lola's middling with no boost by making it easier. We upgrade her to fight better so she don't need to do this roundabout escapade anymore. ["Look what I found!"](/card/01079) : Her 3 is actually kind of nice to intentionally get activation on 2-4 shroud on Standard. I decided to remove all [Flashlight](/card/01087) (which requires setup) and left 2x of these for clue helping she could. (But remember that her primary role is a fighter, get a clue finder teammates.) # Mid upgrade notes You will get the next Lv. 3 card : [Will to Survive](/card/01085), to add to Lv. 3 [Lupara](/card/03309). This card is similarly tricky that you need to be in role the earlier turn, so next turn you can [Will to Survive](/card/01085) and swap to whatever you want to do. (Likely to shoot the guns.) Though, if you want to stay with enemy this turn so the next turn you have full actions to [Will to Survive](/card/01085), you may use [Cherished Keepsake](/card/03114) / [Leather Coat](/card/01072) to take hits. Play [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) will give you more 100% success actions. [Improvisation](/card/03018) can also help with the cost and bypass one role swap. The final Lv. 3 card is 1x [True Survivor](/card/03273), to take advantage of 6x generic skill cards with Innate on it. Only [Overpower](/card/01091) is Practiced and incompatible. # Late upgrade notes The final piece of constant buff is [Police Badge](/card/01027). With 4 , [Guts](/card/01089) will finally work to fully cancel those 2 horror treacheries she might get. The badge's +2 action combo with [Will to Survive](/card/01085) and [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) to give you a big, stage drama protagonist turn. Please try going for this! (You need to be in to use on the badge, and likely [.45 Automatic (2)](/card/03190) with a lot of ammo ready.) An another 3 card combo costing 4 resources to deal guaranteed 6 damage in a pinch is using [Improvisation](/card/03018) to to play [Will to Survive](/card/01085) at 1 cost, then swap to to play [Lupara](/card/03309) at 3 cost (ignoring AoO, you must be already with enemy) then shoot 2 times at starting 5 . Without touching the chaos bag she probably can match almost all enemies in the game. The remaining is upgrading the poor [Beat Cop](/card/01018) allies and patch things up with [Charisma](/card/01694) so you can have both [Leo De Luca](/card/01048) and [Beat Cop](/card/01018). (Or 2x [Beat Cop](/card/01018)) You probably need both on the field for end game for buff and soaks. Try using [Improvisation](/card/03018) to help with Ally play cost while gearing up. Good luck! # Ways to shoot yourself in the foot Examples : - You cannot play [.45 Automatic (2)](/card/03190) while engaged and skip AoO with [Narrow Escape](/card/03267), since to play the gun you must be in , but to play [Narrow Escape](/card/03267) you need to be . - [Narrow Escape](/card/03267) has very nice icons, but you need to be . - If you were just fighting with [Lupara](/card/03309) then you can't [Dodge](/card/01023) unless you didn't role swap or you spend extra to do the Taboo role swap.

deck.name: Mean Minh : The Assistant Strikes Back
deck.description_md:
This Minh . **Expansions :** The Path to Carcosa, Edge of the Earth, The Scarlet Keys.
I create decks using no more than 3 expansions for newcomers. [See more here!](https://arkhamdb.com/decklists/find?author=5argon) Recently I was able to form a new play group with 2 newcomers, so I let them to choose whatever and I fill in the missing piece. For some reason Seeker is quite an unattractive role no one ever wanted to play, I always get to be the clue worker. I tried sneaking in evasion and arcane attacks in several previous decks, but it wasn't scratching the itch to hit things. This time is different, I will be hitting things while able to fill in Seeker role with this Minh. Average she can get is 4~5 with [Michael Leigh](/card/08086) supporting the +1 damage. Ideal accuracy can get up to 7 with : [Gravedigger's Shovel](/card/03037) + [Michael Leigh](/card/08086) + [Scientific Theory](/card/08040) + [Dissection Tools](/card/09043) (2 evidences). If they are not quite lining up, she can still cheat a win with [Anatomical Diagrams](/card/03108) + [Map the Area](/card/09048) + [Gumption](/card/09112) + [Exploit Weakness](/card/09105). Also with 2x [Unexpected Courage](/card/01093) + 2x [Strength in Numbers](/card/08077), fixing [The King in Yellow](/card/03011) is not that frustrating. For intrepid players, **this deck is true solo compatible**. At least it is a good time to add [Vicious Blow](/card/01025) here to resist up to about -3, -4 token. - With 2 dogs, they are unlimited 2 damage hit with 7 accuracy, but only one use per turn. Since [.32 Colt](/card/03020) has no accuracy boost, this is an excellent option to kill-steal 2 HP enemy engaging with others with less risk of friendly-fire, or hitting Retaliate enemy. Try putting all the damages on dogs so Mark can fully use [Sophie](/card/03009) 4 times. (e.g. For clutch Evade at 5 , for treachery defense at 5 .) 6x level 0 cards to assemble the dogs : [Calling in Favors](/card/03158), [Hit and Run](/card/09066), and [Motivational Speech](/card/09028) makes his 1st scenario game much less swingy to treachery. - [**Old Shotgun**](/card/08088) •• : There are dogs to serve as his sidearm, he has the hand slot free to summon the shotgun in correct way ([Ever Vigilant (1)](/card/03023), [Ever Vigilant (4)](/card/09039), [Prepared for the Worst (2)](/card/09036) makes it enter with 2 ammo), conserve ammo, or trying to refill with [Extra Ammunition](/card/01026), while fighting smaller enemies with [Sled Dog](/card/08127). [Guard Dog](/card/01021) can deal extra damage. [Guard Dog (2)](/card/09034) can get an engage for rescuing others and counters automatic 1 damage. [Sled Dog](/card/08127) can perform 1 exhaust attack before going back to hand. - [**On the Trail**](/card/08084) • / [**On the Trail**](/card/08085) ••• : Thematic inclusion just because there are dogs in the artwork... though, sometimes Mark can make distance with [Sled Dog](/card/08127)'s multi Move and get some clues for real. - [**Motivational Speech**](/card/09028) : Motivate all the dogs to 0 cost, plus you are able to play mid-engagement due to Parley. Parley make it possible to find emergency meat shield for [Toe to Toe](/card/08020) when caught off guard by an enemy with no Ally in play yet, like [Hit and Run](/card/09066). - [**Inspiring Presence**](/card/03228) : The one sided heal is good for [Sled Dog](/card/08127) which comes with both health and sanity room, for damage / horror distribution flexibility. The ready is sometimes useful for [Guard Dog (2)](/card/09034) to get 2 different engages in high player count. - [**Ever Vigilant**](/card/03023) • / [**Ever Vigilant**](/card/09039) •••• : 1x to [Stick to the Plan](/card/03264). Throw all the [Old Shotgun](/card/08088) away from your pre-mulligan hand to make ways for the dogs. - [**Extra Ammunition**](/card/01526) • : Purchased 1x to [Stick to the Plan](/card/03264). Makes even 0 ammo [Old Shotgun](/card/08088) became playable. - [**Toe to Toe**](/card/08020) : Excellent card since Mark has a lot of dogs to take the hit, and then he gets a draw . The card costing 0 resource to play is a treat! - [**Obsidian Bracelet**](/card/09024) : Eventually all removed but it is very good to take damage treachery from others, like low Seeker friend, which Mark then gets a draw since damage is placed on a card he control. [Ever Vigilant](/card/03023) makes it easier to put down. - [**Rod of Animalism**](/card/08128) • : Further discount for [Ever Vigilant](/card/03023) plays of the dogs to just 1 cost. deck.name: ☻ 2 Packs Deck Guide : No Stone Unturned Full Support
deck.description_md:
In The Path to Carcosa Investigator Expansion they put [Eidetic Memory](/card/03306) right next to [No Stone Unturned (5)](/card/03307) as a big hint, so let's take the bait! That means 16 XP goes poof just by these 2 cards. How can we fit the rest of the deck so they are ready by ~20 XP for the finale, and how to efficiently deal with her [The King in Yellow](/card/03011) along the way? This deck's strength lies on your team, since [No Stone Unturned (5)](/card/03307) is best combined with other's high XP purchase. (Especially when they could only afford 1x at some point.) Your XP are all gone because this card. Minh can assemble very specific combo for anyone in the party. (Like [Shotgun](/card/01029) + [Extra Ammunition](/card/01026), [Contraband](/card/02109) + some guns, or any Exceptional card which allows only 1 copy.) This deck is also very careful about skill icons on **non-Skill cards** from 0 XP to the finish line, geared for beginners to learn how to get rid of [The King in Yellow](/card/03011) naturally without too many precautions. If you are struggled with this and is trying to build your own Minh deck, feel free to make use of [The King in Yellow](/card/03011) guide below. **► About "2 Packs Deck Guide"**
　A series of decks made with the new distribution model in mind, requiring a Revised Core Set box + **just 1 more** Investigator Expansion box. ☻ character on the deck's name means the additional box it uses is [**The Path to Carcosa Investigator Expansion**](https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror-the-card-game/products/path-carcosa-investigator-expansion/).
　It maximizes the chance of newcomers being able to build and learn to play the game, enjoying the story on Standard difficulty ASAP. They can then get into deck-building later if they wished to do so. [**See other decks in the "2 Packs Deck Guide" series here.**](https://arkhamdb.com/decklists/find?author=5argon&name=Packs+Deck+Guide) **Note :** I have an another 2 packs Minh deck that is less supportive and more evasive : [No Enemy Foretold](https://arkhamdb.com/decklist/view/39924/2-packs-deck-guide-no-enemy-foretold-1.0), if you don't like this literal but thematic "Assistant" style. # Upgrade guide [//]: # (==================== TABLE START ====================) | | | | | 　Cost | 　Total | |:-:|:--|:-:|:--|--:|--:| |　　| [Magnifying Glass](/card/01530) |　→　| [Magnifying Glass](/card/01540) •|1 XP|1 XP| |　　| [Magnifying Glass](/card/01530) |　→　| [Magnifying Glass](/card/01540) •|1 XP|2 XP| |　　| [Lantern](/card/03036) |　→　| [Newspaper](/card/03313) ••|2 XP|4 XP| |　　| [No Stone Unturned](/card/03026) |　→　| [No Stone Unturned](/card/03307) •••••|5 XP|9 XP| |　　| [No Stone Unturned](/card/03026) |　→　| [No Stone Unturned](/card/03307) •••••|5 XP|14 XP| |　　| [Lantern](/card/03036) |　→　| [Newspaper](/card/03313) ••|2 XP|16 XP| |　　| [Guidance](/card/03265) |　→　| [Eidetic Memory](/card/03306) •••|3 XP|19 XP| |　　| [Guidance](/card/03265) |　→　| [Eidetic Memory](/card/03306) •••|3 XP|22 XP| |　| | | | | | | | **Extra** | | | | 22 XP | |　　| [Leather Coat](/card/01572) |　→　|[Bulletproof Vest](/card/01594) •••|3 XP|25 XP| |　　| [Leather Coat](/card/01572) |　→　|[Bulletproof Vest](/card/01594) •••|3 XP|28 XP| |　　| [Rabbit's Foot](/card/01575) |　→　|[Elder Sign Amulet](/card/01595) •••|3 XP|31 XP| |　　| [Rabbit's Foot](/card/01575) |　→　|[Elder Sign Amulet](/card/01595) •••|3 XP|34 XP| [(View at arkham-starter.com)](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/upgrade?) [//]: # (===================== TABLE END =====================) This plan aims so you have at least 1x [No Stone Unturned (5)](/card/03307) ready when the other fighters / spell casters are trying to get high XP card in the deck. I predict the 3rd scenario at 9 XP. I call this "staying on-sync" with the team. Getting 2x [Newspaper (2)](/card/03313) first makes it too late and the fighter may already have got a big gun in the deck that needs your assistant, so I get only one at first. Best if you have 2x [No Stone Unturned (5)](/card/03307) as they are struggling to add 1x big gun, saving for the other 1x. You can make that powerful card "virtually" 2x in the mean time. I predict the fighter gets full set of cards at 20 XP. So Minh must be selfless and ahead by completing full set of 2x [No Stone Unturned (5)](/card/03307) at 14 XP. If someone wants to play , they maybe delighted to try out some unplayed Exceptional card as game rule forced 1x inclusion and is very XP expensive. [No Stone Unturned (5)](/card/03307) is so good at this the investigator will wants to marry you. # Next level role-play : What makes a good Assistant? Official "Table Talk" suggestion is that you cannot reveal what you have in your hand or going to play from hand. This includes the star of this deck [No Stone Unturned (5)](/card/03307) on your hand. Often, the table knows you have NSU as soon as you are asking what do they want. But you can take the role-playing experience to the next level by not asking and instead keep track of everyone's discard pile (an open information). Then try suddenly play this card and see if you can read the need in their mind or not! If you took a look at everyone's deck beforehand, you know exactly what cards are left to search, **minus** the cards on their hand that you cannot see. They too cannot say "I already have it in my hand, so no need to use [No Stone Unturned (5)](/card/03307)." So that's an another failure point that would get some lols. Since NSU also need to be the same location, there is also a risk of meeting up only to end up with no one wanting anything from their deck, when you cannot directly talk about the needs of a specific card when you were remote from each other. Consider this as a more challenging mode of play, but it is really fun. (One hardcore gaming group I play with even restrict any talk as if everyone has permanent Peril on them, unless they are at the same location!! We can only talk remotely/telepathically about Investigation Phase turn order!) # Let's talk about The King in Yellow (But do not say his name.) ## Icons on non-Skill cards This deck cares about skill icons **on non-Skill card** a lot to fix her [The King in Yellow](/card/03011), since I think this is the most annoying part for beginners. This weakness force Minh to care about icons on Asset and Event cards because it is hard to find 3 chunky Skills in the first place (and it would be a shame to throw them all just to fix this weakness). You want any card draw ([Rabbit's Foot](/card/01075) / [Analytical Mind](/card/03010)) to have a chance of fixing this ASAP, to make a solid Minh deck. Minh deck which does not care about icon concentration may perform much better, **only until** [The King in Yellow](/card/03011) hits then she is crippled. This deck is defensive. So, cards like [Mind over Matter](/card/01036) () or [Fieldwork](/card/03024) () are sadly out. Because Minh would have hard time to commit 3x to clear or test. (And she do not want to go punch evils just to dispel [The King in Yellow](/card/03011), let she be in her office.) We want either or icons. Instead ["Look what I found!"](/card/01079) which may look unnecessary for Seeker is in the deck to help with its double icons, never removed. [Logical Reasoning](/card/03191) is also a good card to **not play** but use to pass treachery that swoop in once in a while, but you must find [Eureka!](/card/03231), or few remaining commit to get to 3x commit count. ## Wild You know Minh adds , but don't forget about commit rule. **You cannot commit icon not matching the test.** And because her ability is "After", a card must be a legit commit first before you can add +. For this reason, a card with in the first place is great for Minh even with the text box blank! This deck has "questionable card" 2x [Guidance](/card/03265) and 2x [No Stone Unturned (0)](/card/03026). You will find unfavorable reviews if you look inside, but for Minh the commit icon is a feature! These cards are just as good as more copies of [Unexpected Courage](/card/01093), for helping any kind of problems for others, or fixing [The King in Yellow](/card/03011) for yourself. One very important application for a lot of single cards we have in this deck is to make 4+ for emergency evade vs. 2-3 enemies on Standard. It let you able to go separate way from your fighter for a little bit. [Rabbit's Foot](/card/01075), [Guidance](/card/03265), [No Stone Unturned (0)](/card/03026)? ...they are all draw-less [Manual Dexterity](/card/01092). ## Attention! : Icons on Item trait on Item asset are important as it has synergy with [Scavenging](/card/01073) to get the icon back on hand ready to fix [The King in Yellow](/card/03011). Refilling [Flashlight](/card/01087) supplies after bumping it away with [Magnifying Glass (1)](/card/01040) is one classic move, you will have many moments that Item is on hand as they recurs, about to be replayed. If [The King in Yellow](/card/03011) hits in that time, then you have some head start and change your mind to commit them instead. [Magnifying Glass (1)](/card/01040) is an item with that built-in ability that "counters" [The King in Yellow](/card/03011). Just pick up and commit! Then try [Scavenging](/card/01073) back later once you gain back an ability to commit 1 card. Then the upgrade [Newspaper (2)](/card/03313) is a very good card here not only because of its ability, but because Minh is a commit beast and [Newspaper (2)](/card/03313) can keep coming back via its Item trait. It has excellent icons that became huge feature for Minh. Looks like her part time job is newspaper delivery... Then we have [Rabbit's Foot](/card/01075) that is as precious as a commit as playing it. With Minh's +, they are [Unexpected Courage](/card/01093) that can come back via [Scavenging](/card/01073). Sometimes I feel a bit sad equipping it instead of committing it. (Best to equip one, and find an another to recur for committing.) [Scavenging](/card/01073) make sure not all hope is lost when you get that while going all in trying to fix [The King in Yellow](/card/03011). # Minh's ability tips Bring some kind of on-off tokens representing each investigator in the team including yourself, to keep track whether someone still have the + quota or not. It is really easy to miss, especially those who walk into your location thinking they cannot pass the test. **Their** cards also get , it does not have to be your card. You just stand still! You also prone to forget how many the round quotas were used in Mythos Phase, to decide whether you can go offensive in Investigation Phase or not. Also it does not have to be Skill card. (But effect requires Skill card.) Her ability helps fixing [The King in Yellow](/card/03011), so you actually require 5 icons and not 6 as you get for free. # Card tips [**Bulletproof Vest**](/card/01594) •••, [**Elder Sign Amulet**](/card/01595) ••• They being in Extra section on the upgrade looks like mindless sprinkles, but don't forget about [Scavenging](/card/01073) **and** also potential of very high icon count with Minh's +. ( and ) --- [**Eidetic Memory**](/card/03306) ••• It is not just for [No Stone Unturned](/card/03307), playing [Logical Reasoning](/card/03191) from discard pile is also excellent. As you can make use of the commit first (adds to even allow a to pass test) and then play from discard for effect if that test fails and cause horror. Double insurances! I already mentioned that will love your [No Stone Unturned (5)](/card/03307) to get their Exceptional out. This is another reason to pair this Minh with a . --- [**No Stone Unturned**](/card/03307) ••••• Being team player is good but don't forget about grabbing [Analytical Mind](/card/03010) for yourself.

[//]: # (===================== TABLE END =====================) : Add when you reach 15 XP. Should be the same time you get [Keen Eye](/card/02185), now you can occasionally use the pump to work on clues full turn at 4 . **True Solo :** Swap the [Keen Eye](/card/02185) to be the first 3 XP upgrade instead, so you are less likely to struggle with the investigation. Try go for 6 XP or higher in the 1st scenario! Triple attack will became much more usable. At 30 XP where the campaign is likely ending, you can choose 1 more Discipline (not in the Side Deck). Choose any as you like, but I would pick one so you can heal yourself back after using [Toe to Toe](/card/08020) inside a combo / horror cost of [Ward of Protection](/card/01065). # How to play With [Keen Eye](/card/02185) purchased very early on, Lily can get carryover stat bonus across all attacks for both [ Discipline](/card/08014a) and [Butterfly Swords](/card/08025). It helps mitigating some risk of having to pull many chaos tokens, avoiding "if you fail" effects. "Different Fight" actions to be used with [ Discipline](/card/08014a) are the [Butterfly Swords](/card/08025), basic fight, throwing [Knife](/card/01086) hidden in the [Bandolier](/card/02147), and finally Fight Event played from hand. These Fight Event from hand must be **cheap**, or a combo would make you broke. We have : 2x [Toe to Toe](/card/08020), 2x [Sweeping Kick](/card/08023), and the peak "**finish him**" moment [Monster Slayer](/card/02300) added later as a fun toy. Everything costs either 1 or 0 resource to play. The 2nd Discipline to add is [ Discipline](/card/08012a). Its ability (from now on referred to as "hand refill") can be used to grab some Fight Events in a hurry. Unusually low amount of equip assets improve the chance of dumping the hand and flip back this Discipline for more hand refills. The final touch is that we need some damage plus card that can be used to add oomph to any attacks performed as a part of triple attack, so she is more flexible to make HP of multiple enemies become 0 exactly at the same time. (Making basic fight or the 1st hit of [Butterfly Swords](/card/08025) deal 2 damages is handy.) This is the expensive [Michael Leigh](/card/08086), which links into [ Discipline](/card/08012a) you just added so you now have 4 to work on with [Flashlight](/card/01087). [Keen Eye](/card/02185) can add if you need many evidences refilled in a pinch. Multiple enemies to fight with can be summoned from [On the Hunt](/card/03263), [Drawn to the Flame](/card/01064), and [Delve Too Deep](/card/02111). [Butterfly Swords](/card/08025), [Michael Leigh](/card/08086), and [Vicious Blow](/card/01025) improve the chance of clearing them out quick enough. Use bounty money from [On the Hunt](/card/03263) to help fuel [Keen Eye](/card/02185). # How to solo? I have put a "solo" tag due to investigation power gained in the later half. But it will be pain until you get [Michael Leigh](/card/08086) and Discipline. Before that point, it is critical to hog [Drawn to the Flame](/card/01064) for the 3-4 shrouds, and treat [Perception](/card/01090) / [Unexpected Courage](/card/01093) like treasure, only popping them in your important [Flashlight](/card/01087) test. Upgrade plan moves [Keen Eye](/card/02185) to the first upgrade. +1 for 2 resources is your ray of hope with your 3 supplies [Flashlight](/card/01087). Keep [Flashlight](/card/01087) full before you do this since the boost stays active for an entire phase. Lastly, solo is rarely balanced to any deck. # 5 splash cards That means what are the 5 cards we chosen for her to born with. 2x [**Bandolier**](/card/02147) Critical to equip [Knife](/card/01086) / [Flashlight](/card/01087) while playing with [Butterfly Swords](/card/08025).
2x [**Toe to Toe**](/card/08020) The cheapest Fight Event we have to use with "triple attack". It is really handy since it has perfect accuracy, saving you both play cost and commit cards for the other attacks in the triple attack chain. But watch your health and sanity!
1x [**Prepared for the Worst**](/card/02184) This is a virtual copy of [Butterfly Swords](/card/08025). The only other target is [Knife](/card/01086). You may include 2x of this but 1x [Bandolier](/card/02147) instead, both are related to gearing up this Lily. I take 1x to put more weight in [Flashlight](/card/01087) x [Bandolier](/card/02147) x [Michael Leigh](/card/08086) play. # How to fight in early scenarios [Knife](/card/01086), [Toe to Toe](/card/08020), and [Manual Dexterity](/card/01092) are extremely valuable. They allows you to have more choices inside your [ Discipline](/card/08014a) triple attack. When you get 3 or 4 HP enemy, often you can use triple attack in combination with [Knife](/card/01086)'s 2 different Fight to get its HP down to 2 however you like. Once that happens, then it is GG with [Toe to Toe](/card/08020)'s test-less 2 damage as your final different Fight inside the triple attack. [Knife](/card/01086) has 2 choices which are considered "different Fight". So for 3 HP enemy, it is fine to try your first 2 attacks and hit it with +1 once, then use the +2 +1 damage option to finish it off and discard the [Knife](/card/01086). Two in one Asset is good since you don't want to include your unboosted barefisted Fight just so it is "different". Not anymore that [William Yorick](/card/03005) is the only one stylin with the [Knife](/card/01086)! If inside triple attack you made 2 attacks and can't quite get the HP down to 2, you may change your mind to Evade with [Manual Dexterity](/card/01092) instead. (Discipline flips over after the final action, you still have +1 bonus while evading inside the triple attack.) [Manual Dexterity](/card/01092) is never removed for this reason because it gives flexibility to the triple attack, letting you see the result of 1-2 fights first. Because [Holy Rosary](/card/01059) are removed but not immediately that [Michael Leigh](/card/08086) are added, you have some period that you have no soak. Be very careful about using [Toe to Toe](/card/08020) around this point. (5 XP ~ 15 XP) # Card tips [**Monster Slayer**](/card/02300) ••••• The ability make it obvious that damage does not matter, but the accuracy does since it doesn't give you any bonus. Therefore, when playing as a part of "triple attack" you must buff it with some . It is purchased after [Michael Leigh](/card/08086) so you at least have 5 . Still, you should put in [Overpower](/card/01091) or other commits. [Keen Eye](/card/02185) can add to it as well, a bit expensive but good value if you are doing triple attacks with [Butterfly Swords](/card/08025) in it.
[**On the Hunt**](/card/08028) ••• Though this Lily could somewhat investigate in her free time, this card can make sure you don't have to run around and grab enemies from Seekers. You can make the encounter deck "sparkling clean" on your own instead of struggling with gathering clue. Also important so her "triple attack" is utilized to the fullest instead of hitting airs. You may search for Victory Point enemy and get closer to 30 XP faster where you get the 3rd discipline. (Your choice) This also has subtle synergy with [Ward of Protection](/card/01065) which is never removed. That card cannot cancel enemy spawn, so the more you use [On the Hunt](/card/03263), the more chance of getting "Revelation" mythos draw that could be canceled with [Ward of Protection](/card/01065).
[**Ward of Protection**](/card/01565) This is a staple, but just to note that it is also a quick fix when you get Revelation card instead of enemy when you [Delve Too Deep](/card/02111) or [Drawn to the Flame](/card/01064).
[**Emergency Cache**](/card/01588) 2 copies are not getting removed ever, even when 2x [On the Hunt](/card/08028) are all added. When you add [Michael Leigh](/card/08086), this Lily will be really hungry for a quick shot of resources so she can get going with him, plus to use [Keen Eye](/card/02185). Find some time to use it, maybe when trying to flip back Discipline in isolation.
[**Flashlight**](/card/01587) This is critical to make [Michael Leigh](/card/08086) work as she need to somehow investigate. It is also the reason that [Bandolier](/card/02147) is included in the splash. Together with Discipline's static boost it is enough to get some evidences. From [Bandolier](/card/02147)'s description (Weapon trait only) it may looks like you put one half of the [Butterfly Swords](/card/08025) in it while you hold an another half, and [Flashlight](/card/01087) in the other hand. This is totally fine. Slots are upper limit rather than a physical slot, and 2-handed weapon is just using 2 out of that limit.
[**Manual Dexterity**](/card/01592) This is not removed. Not only that her 4 + 2 will be reassuring to avoid treachery, just to remind you that Discipline allows using basic evade as a part of combo, not just Fight. The real power is in changing your mind when you see the enemy is not going down after you missed 1 or 2 attacks. Many enemies have annoying ability disabled when they are not ready, so sometimes sneaking in evasion is useful to reach the next round safely, while getting in some hits.
[**Perception**](/card/01590) Also not removed, it improve the chance of refilling [Michael Leigh](/card/08086)'s evidence even when you can't get the [Flashlight](/card/01087) + [Bandolier](/card/02147) combo going. Or just when you have no choice but to investigate difficult locations just to get the evidences ready.

deck.name: ☻ 2 Packs Deck Guide : Mystic with Economy
deck.description_md:
This basic deck plays similar to Revised Core Set [Agnes Baker](/card/01004) ([Shrivelling](/card/01060) + [Rite of Seeking (2)](/card/01689) + [Holy Rosary](/card/01059) + [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063)), but stuff make things a bit different. **► About "2 Packs Deck Guide"**
　A series of decks made with the new distribution model in mind, requiring a Revised Core Set box + **just 1 more** Investigator Expansion box. ☻ character on the deck's name means the additional box it uses is [**The Path to Carcosa Investigator Expansion**](https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror-the-card-game/products/path-carcosa-investigator-expansion/).
　It maximizes the chance of newcomers being able to build and learn to play the game, enjoying the story on Standard difficulty ASAP. They can then get into deck-building later if they wished to do so. [**See other decks in the "2 Packs Deck Guide" series here.**](https://arkhamdb.com/decklists/find?author=5argon&name=Packs+Deck+Guide) [//]: # (==================== TABLE START ====================) | | | | | 　Cost | 　Total | |:-:|:--|:-:|:--|--:|--:| | | **19 XP Deck** | | | | 0 XP | |　　|[Flashlight](/card/01587) |　→　| [Rite of Seeking](/card/01689) ••|2 XP|2 XP| |　　|[Flashlight](/card/01587) |　→　| [Rite of Seeking](/card/01689) ••|2 XP|4 XP| |　　| [Fearless](/card/01567) |　→　| [Spirit Athame](/card/03035) •|1 XP|5 XP| |　　| [Fearless](/card/01567) |　→　| [Spirit Athame](/card/03035) •|1 XP|6 XP| |　　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01588) |　→　| [Hot Streak](/card/01557) ••••|4 XP|10 XP| |　　|[Emergency Cache](/card/01588) |　→　| [Hot Streak](/card/01557) ••••|4 XP|14 XP| |　　|[Manual Dexterity](/card/01592) |　→　| [Moxie](/card/03111) •|1 XP|15 XP| |　　|[Manual Dexterity](/card/01592) |　→　| [Moxie](/card/03111) •|1 XP|16 XP| |　　|[Guts](/card/01589) |　→　| [Sure Gamble](/card/01556) •••|3 XP|19 XP| |　| | | | | | | | **29 XP Deck** | | | | 19 XP | |　　| [Ward of Protection](/card/01565) |　→　| [Ward of Protection](/card/03270) ••|2 XP|21 XP| |　　| [Ward of Protection](/card/01565) |　→　| [Ward of Protection](/card/03270) ••|2 XP|23 XP| |　　| [Sneak Attack](/card/01552) |　→　| [Sneak Attack](/card/03152) ••|2 XP|25 XP| |　　| [Sneak Attack](/card/01552) |　→　| [Sneak Attack](/card/03152) ••|2 XP|27 XP| |　| | | | | | | | **Extra** | | | | 27 XP | |　　|[Guts](/card/01589) |　→　| [Sure Gamble](/card/01556) •••|3 XP|30 XP| |　　|[Unexpected Courage](/card/01593) |　→　| [Recharge](/card/03197) ••|2 XP|32 XP| |　　|[Unexpected Courage](/card/01593) |　→　| [Recharge](/card/03197) ••|2 XP|34 XP| [(View at arkham-starter.com)](https://arkham-starter.com/tool/upgrade?%3D%3D) [//]: # (===================== TABLE END =====================) You may notice a card [Suggestion (4)](/card/03268) in your The Path to Carcosa Investigator Expansion purchase which looks like it is made just for Sefina. This deck devoted the XP for 2x [Hot Streak](/card/01057) instead in the pre 20 XP range. Then at 20 XP, I think it is time for [Sure Gamble](/card/01056) to get in the deck to handle late campaign negative values when killing stuff with a basic [Shrivelling](/card/01060) or performing critical Evade. Therefore we have no moment to add [Suggestion (4)](/card/03268), unfortunately! - She can neutral Evade to prolong fight turns or get a brief moment to gear up. - [**Moxie**](/card/03111) • : pumps both for Spell accuracy and to avoid getting hit. [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063) (1/2) and [Holy Rosary](/card/01059) (/2) are both great core set cards that provide high Sanity buffer at cheap play cost, helps soaks the horror instead of having to break the Composure. It just clicks with combination. - [**Narrow Escape**](/card/03267) : Amazing Event with many many uses in this deck. Removes a lot of clunkiness. - You can just simply setup something like [Shrivelling](/card/01060) with engaged enemy, and use the +2 to cast accurately right away. - You want to use [Rite of Seeking (2)](/card/01689) on your last action each round, to work around the turn ending penalty. With an enemy, Investigate takes Attack of Opportunity and may ruin that chance now and then. This card allows you to still take the chance and even get +2 for that Investigate, you have at least 8 to resist even -4 vs. 4 shroud. - [Uncage the Soul](/card/03033) is useful to setup Spell Asset, but for Fight Spell Event like [Storm of Spirits](/card/03153) you have to take Attack of Opportunity when trying to discount it. But with [Narrow Escape](/card/03267), you avoid the hit, get the discount, and even get +2 towards [Storm of Spirits](/card/03153) accuracy which previously has no boost. - Use non-fast Event like [Sneak Attack (2)](/card/03152) or [Drawn to the Flame](/card/01064) while you have an enemy, and bank the +2 for anything that comes next. - [**Hot Streak**](/card/01557) •••• : Pure economy for [Moxie](/card/03111) pumps and refreshing Spell Asset with a new one. If you managed to get it under Sefina and use [The Painted World](/card/03012), you are well off for long time. - [**Sneak Attack**](/card/03152) •• : Test-less damage that is very good in high player count, since there are more chances that an enemy spawns on someone else but not you. - [**Sure Gamble**](/card/01556) ••• : A quite costly card (XP and play cost too) but can be a game changer in last few scenarios where the tokens are really amped up in negative value. I think to give Sefina a unique identity, it is important we try playing around with Lv. 3+ cards. - [**"Watch this!"**](/card/03233) : The icon is great for spells, as well as being quite safe to bet 3 resources when using [Rite of Seeking (2)](/card/01689) (+2 ) with [Spirit Athame](/card/03035) (+2 ). Typical Rogue has like 1~2 would not say "Watch this!" as easily as Sefina on test. For the side : - [**Spirit Athame**](/card/03035) • : Adds +2 accuracy to [Shrivelling](/card/01060) which previously does not have any accuracy bonus. Takes the pressure off finding one of 2x [Holy Rosary](/card/01059) a bit for a Mystic with 4 . (But you should still find it.) - [**Rite of Seeking**](/card/01689) •• : Insanely good card in Revised Core Set due to built-in +2 accuracy. On Standard, you will be quite consistent in tackling 4 shroud with this card. Add ["Watch this!"](/card/03233) on this test if you are lacking resources. - [**Ward of Protection**](/card/03270) •• : Share the love more times with [The Painted World](/card/03012). Remember that [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063) can search for them. - [**Recharge**](/card/03197) •• : Positioned at the bottom of upgrades so likely that you won't reach them, but it is that [Arcane Initiate](/card/01063) can search since it is a Spell, and allow more of the satisfying [Rite of Seeking (2)](/card/01689). # Note on [Stars of Hyades](/card/03013) The "If your deck has 5 or more cards..." clause is brutal. You will run out of "ideas" (the cards underneath her) before it gets to that point. Imagine that your deck had thinned down to 10 cards. You have also hit 1-2 [Stars of Hyades](/card/03013) before this point, and you are down to 0-3 Event. Right now if [Stars of Hyades](/card/03013) is on the top 5 cards instead of the bottom 5, you lose! Then it shuffles back into the deck of about, let's say 7 cards. Then, if [Stars of Hyades](/card/03013) is on top 3 of that 7 cards, you lose again! It gets harder and harder towards that 5 cards threshold, which at that point.. you have to hit [Stars of Hyades](/card/03013) **again** one last time in this iteration of the deck it finally goes to the discard pile. You rarely play long enough to get to that point of deck-out unless you draws often (like having [Pickpocketing](/card/01046), which I avoid) so you may as well read that once the deck thins down to single digit count Sefina just randomly dies. Not only you lose your precious Health, you lose so many draws. In this deck, we have 2 mitigators : - 2x [**Arcane Initiate**](/card/01563) : This is a drawing that avoids [Stars of Hyades](/card/03013), so always welcomed as the deck thins down more and more. - 1x [**Quantum Flux**](/card/03196) : Do not count on the 5 cards criteria, just simulate the deck-out on your own. Because this is situational, I add only 1 copy. You should hold onto it until you get to about last 30% of the deck before using it, I think.
